ITEMINFO_000	???
ITEMINFO_001	The best Poké Ball with the ultimate level of\nperformance. With it, you will catch any wild\nPokémon without fail.
ITEMINFO_002	An ultra-high-performance Poké Ball that provides\na higher success rate for catching Pokémon than\na Great Ball.
ITEMINFO_003	A good, high-performance Poké Ball that provides\na higher success rate for catching Pokémon than\na standard Poké Ball.
ITEMINFO_004	A device for catching wild Pokémon. It’s thrown like\na ball at a Pokémon, comfortably encapsulating\nits target.
ITEMINFO_005	-\n-\n-
ITEMINFO_006	A somewhat different Poké Ball that is more\neffective when attempting to catch Water- or\nBug-type Pokémon.
ITEMINFO_007	A somewhat different Poké Ball that works\nespecially well when catching Pokémon that\nlive underwater.
ITEMINFO_008	A somewhat different Poké Ball that becomes more\neffective the lower the level of the wild Pokémon.
ITEMINFO_009	A somewhat different Poké Ball that works\nespecially well on a Pokémon species that has been\ncaught before.
ITEMINFO_010	A somewhat different Poké Ball that becomes\nprogressively more effective the more turns that\nare taken in battle.
ITEMINFO_011	A particularly comfortable Poké Ball that makes a\nwild Pokémon quickly grow friendlier after\nbeing caught.
ITEMINFO_012	A somewhat rare Poké Ball that was made as a\ncommemorative item used to celebrate an event of\nsome sort.
ITEMINFO_013	A somewhat different Poké Ball that makes it\neasier to catch wild Pokémon at night or in dark\nplaces such as caves.
ITEMINFO_014	A remedial Poké Ball that restores the HP of a\nPokémon caught with it and eliminates any\nstatus conditions.
ITEMINFO_015	A somewhat different Poké Ball that has a more\nsuccessful catch rate if used at the start of a\nwild encounter.
ITEMINFO_016	A quite rare Poké Ball that has been crafted in order\nto commemorate a special occasion of some sort.
ITEMINFO_017	A spray-type medicine for treating wounds. It can\nbe used to restore 20 HP to a single Pokémon.
ITEMINFO_018	A spray-type medicine for treating poisoning. It can be\nused to lift the effects of being poisoned from\na single Pokémon.
ITEMINFO_019	A spray-type medicine for treating burns. It can be\nused to heal a single Pokémon suffering from a burn.
ITEMINFO_020	A spray-type medicine for treating freezing. It can be\nused to thaw out a single Pokémon that has been\nfrozen solid.
ITEMINFO_021	A spray-type medicine to wake the sleeping. It can\nbe used to rouse a single Pokémon from\nthe clutches of sleep.
ITEMINFO_022	A spray-type medicine for treating paralysis. It can be\nused to free a single Pokémon that has been paralyzed.
ITEMINFO_023	A medicine that can be used to fully restore the HP of\na single Pokémon and heal any status conditions it has.
ITEMINFO_024	A spray-type medicine for treating wounds. It can\nbe used to completely restore the max HP of\na single Pokémon.
ITEMINFO_025	A spray-type medicine for treating wounds. It can\nbe used to restore 120 HP to a single Pokémon.
ITEMINFO_026	A spray-type medicine for treating wounds. It can\nbe used to restore 60 HP to a single Pokémon.
ITEMINFO_027	A spray-type medicine that is broadly effective.\nIt can be used to heal all the status conditions\nof a single Pokémon.
ITEMINFO_028	A medicine that can be used to revive a single\nPokémon that has fainted. It also restores half of\nthe Pokémon’s max HP.
ITEMINFO_029	A medicine that can be used to revive a single\nPokémon that has fainted. It also fully restores\nthe Pokémon’s max HP.
ITEMINFO_030	Water with high mineral content. It can be used to\nrestore 30 HP to a single Pokémon.
ITEMINFO_031	A highly carbonated soda drink. It can be used to\nrestore 50 HP to a single Pokémon.
ITEMINFO_032	A very sweet and refreshing drink. It can be used to\nrestore 70 HP to a single Pokémon.
ITEMINFO_033	A bottle of highly nutritious milk. When consumed,\nit restores up to 100 HP to an injured Pokémon.
ITEMINFO_034	A very bitter medicinal powder. When consumed,\nit restores up to 60 HP to an injured Pokémon.
ITEMINFO_035	An extremely bitter medicinal root. When consumed,\nit restores up to 120 HP to an injured Pokémon.
ITEMINFO_036	A very bitter medicinal powder. It can be used once\nto heal all the status conditions of a Pokémon.
ITEMINFO_037	A terribly bitter medicinal herb. It revives a fainted\nPokémon and fully restores its maximum HP.
ITEMINFO_038	This medicine can be used to restore 10 PP to a single\nselected move that has been learned by a Pokémon.
ITEMINFO_039	This medicine can be used to fully restore the PP of\na single selected move that has been learned by\na Pokémon.
ITEMINFO_040	This medicine can be used to restore 10 PP to each of\nthe moves that have been learned by a Pokémon.
ITEMINFO_041	This medicine can be used to fully restore the PP of all\nof the moves that have been learned by a Pokémon.
ITEMINFO_042	Lavaridge Town’s local specialty. It can be used\nonce to heal all the status conditions of a Pokémon.
ITEMINFO_043	A 100 percent pure juice made of Berries.\nWhen consumed, it restores 20 HP to an\ninjured Pokémon.
ITEMINFO_044	This rare ash can revive all fainted Pokémon in a\nparty. In doing so, it also fully restores their\nmaximum HP.
ITEMINFO_045	A nutritious drink for Pokémon. When consumed,\nit raises the base HP of a single Pokémon.
ITEMINFO_046	A nutritious drink for Pokémon. When consumed,\nit raises the base Attack stat of a single Pokémon.

ITEMINFO_050	A candy that is packed with energy. When consumed,\nit will instantly raise the level of a single Pokémon\nby one.

ITEMINFO_053	A medicine that optimally raises the maximum PP\nof a single selected move that has been learned by\na Pokémon.

ITEMINFO_056	An item that greatly raises the critical-hit ratio of\na Pokémon during a battle. It can be used only once\nand wears off if the Pokémon is withdrawn.
ITEMINFO_057	An item that sharply boosts the Attack stat of a\nPokémon during a battle. It wears off once the\nPokémon is withdrawn.
ITEMINFO_058	An item that sharply boosts the Defense stat of a\nPokémon during a battle. It wears off once the\nPokémon is withdrawn.
ITEMINFO_059	An item that sharply boosts the Speed stat of a\nPokémon during a battle. It wears off once the\nPokémon is withdrawn.

ITEMINFO_062	An item that sharply boosts the Sp. Def stat of a\nPokémon during a battle. It wears off once the\nPokémon is withdrawn.

ITEMINFO_069	A flute made from white glass. It makes it easier to\nencounter weak Pokémon in the place you use it.

moving_system.dat
nx_moving_index_010	MOVE
nx_moving_button_000	Back
nx_moving_button_001	Help
nx_moving_guide_010	You can bring Pokémon over from Pokémon Bank\nfor Nintendo 3DS systems.
nx_moving_guide_011	Pokémon brought over from the Nintendo 3DS can’t be sent back!
nx_moving_guide_012	Before moving Pokémon, please check the mobile device version of\nPokémon HOME to see which Pokémon can be moved to which games.
nx_moving_guide_020	Select “Move Pokémon to Pokémon HOME” in\nPokémon Bank for Nintendo 3DS systems.\nThen input the Moving Key.
nx_moving_guide_021	Pokémon HOME can’t be used until\nthe Moving Key has expired.
nx_moving_opt_010	Begin Move
nx_moving_opt_020	No Nintendo 3DS
nx_moving_comment_010	[~]
nx_moving_comment_020	[~]
nx_moving_comment_030	[~]
nx_moving_comment_040	[~]
nx_moving_boxdata_010	Pokémon you can deposit
nx_moving_boxdata_011	[VAR 0203(0000,002C)]
nx_moving_boxdata_020	Empty Boxes
nx_moving_boxdata_021	[VAR 0202(0000)]
nx_moving_pass_010	Current Moving Key
nx_moving_pass_020	Time left
nx_moving_pass_021	[VAR 0201(0000)]:[VAR 0201(0001)]
nx_moving_pass_030	
nx_moving_msg_010	Warning! You’ll be unable to use Pokémon HOME until the\nmove is complete.\r\nDo you want to begin move preparations?
nx_moving_msg_020	Select a Box in the “Move Pokémon to Pokémon HOME”\noption in Pokémon Bank for Nintendo 3DS systems.\c\nThen proceed to the screen where you can enter the\nMoving Key.
nx_moving_msg_025	You may be using an outdated version of Pokémon Bank.\nPlease update to the most recent version.\c\nIf you have any questions, please consult the\nPokémon HOME official website.
nx_moving_msg_030	Moving Keys are only valid for three minutes. Enter the\nkey into Pokémon Bank as soon as you can.\c\nOnce a Moving Key is active, you won’t be able to go\nback until it expires.\c\nDo you want to create a Moving Key?
nx_moving_msg_040	Your Pokémon HOME Boxes are full! Please make some space\nand try again.
nx_moving_msg_050	Pokémon Bank data found! Move preparations will begin.\c\nYou’ll be unable to use Pokémon HOME until the move\nis complete.
nx_moving_msg_060	If you’re having trouble, please consult the Pokémon HOME\nofficial website.
nx_moving_msg_070	The Moving Key has been entered in Pokémon Bank\nsuccessfully! Move preparations will begin.\c\nYou’ll be unable to use Pokémon HOME until the move\nis complete.
nx_moving_msg_075	Checking Moving Key... Please wait.
nx_moving_msg_080	The Moving Key has expired!
nx_moving_msg_090	Check for a Nintendo Network ID that used Pokémon Bank\nconnected to this user’s Nintendo Account?
nx_moving_msg_100	The move will begin automatically if data is\nsuccessfully found.\c\nAll Pokémon from Pokémon Bank will be moved to\nPokémon HOME.\c\nYou’ll be unable to use Pokémon HOME until the move\nis complete.\c\nAre you sure you want to search for a Nintendo Network ID\nand begin the move?
nx_moving_msg_0110	Checking for Pokémon Bank data...\nPlease wait.
nx_moving_msg_0120	[~]
nx_moving_msg_0130	Unable to find Pokémon Bank data that can be moved.\nPlease check the connection to your Nintendo Network ID.\c\nAfter verifying the connection to your Nintendo Network ID,\nwait a little while before trying again.
nx_moving_msg_pot_010	Begin
nx_moving_msg_pot_020	Ready!
nx_moving_msg_pot_025	No “Move” option
nx_moving_msg_pot_030	Display
nx_moving_msg_pot_040	Quit
nx_moving_msg_pot_050	Check
nx_moving_immigrate_010	Yes
nx_moving_immigrate_020	No
nx_moving_immigrate_030	All Boxes as they are
nx_moving_immigrate_040	One Pokémon at a time
nx_moving_immigrate_045	Organize Boxes
nx_moving_immigrate_050	Quit
nx_moving_immigrate_msg_010	Move preparation is complete.\nThere [VAR 1101(0000,0302)]isare [VAR 0203(0000,002C)] Pokémon that can be moved!\c\nHow would you like to move [VAR 1101(0000,0402)]itthem to Boxes in\nPokémon HOME?
nx_moving_immigrate_msg_020	The Pokémon in the Pokémon Bank Boxes will be moved\nas is.\c\nDo you want to save your progress?
nx_moving_immigrate_msg_025	The Pokémon in the Pokémon Bank Boxes will be moved one\nat a time to fill open spaces.\c\nDo you want to save your progress?
nx_moving_immigrate_msg_030	Now saving...\nPlease don’t close Pokémon HOME.
nx_moving_immigrate_msg_040	You saved your progress!\c\nPokémon were moved from Pokémon Bank to your Boxes\nin Pokémon HOME!
nx_moving_immigrate_msg_045	You received [VAR 0203(0000,002C)] Pokémon HOME points for moving for\nthe first time!
nx_moving_immigrate_msg_050	You need [VAR 0202(0000)] more vacant Boxes!\nDo you want to organize your Boxes?
nx_moving_immigrate_msg_060	[~]
nx_moving_immigrate_msg_070	[~]
nx_moving_immigrate_msg_080	[~]
nx_moving_help_010	Bringing Pokémon over from Pokémon Bank on\nNintendo 3DS systems is called moving!
nx_moving_help_020	Choose Begin Move and enter the Moving Key\nin Pokémon Bank to move your Pokémon over to Pokémon HOME!
nx_moving_help_030	A Moving Key is only valid for a little while, so make sure to enter it\nbefore time runs out!\nWhat’s more, while the key is being displayed, you can’t use the other\nfeatures of Pokémon HOME! Golly!
nx_moving_help_035	Neat-o! This is a fun tidbit! When you move Pokémon from\nPokémon Bank, the Pokédex data from Pokémon Bank is carried\nover, too!
nx_moving_help_040	Well, gee whiz! If there’s anything you don’t understand about moving\nor if you don’t have your Nintendo 3DS with you, try checking out the\nPokémon HOME official website!

pokemile_system.dat
nx_pokemile_index_010	POINTS
nx_pokemile_button_000	Back
nx_pokemile_button_001	Help
nx_pokemile_010	Pokémon HOME Points
nx_pokemile_011	[VAR 0204(0000,002C)] point(s)
nx_pokemile_020	1 BP = [VAR 0201(0000)] point(s)
nx_pokemile_030	Points that will be used: [VAR 0204(0000,002C)]
nx_pokemile_040	[VAR 0200(0000)]
nx_pokemile_041	BP
nx_pokemile_050	OK
nx_pokemile_060	Choose how many points to convert to BP
nx_pokemile_061	BP
nx_pokemile_062	[VAR 0203(0000,002C)]/[VAR 0203(0001,002C)]
nx_pokemile_msg_yes	Yes
nx_pokemile_msg_no	No
nx_pokemile_msg_010	You’ll exceed the maximum points for that game if you send\nthat much, so the amount has been changed to send just\r\nas much as possible!

ITEMINFO_000	???
ITEMINFO_001	The very best Poké Ball with the ultimate level of\nperformance. With it, you will catch any wild Pokémon\nwithout fail.
ITEMINFO_002	An ultra-high-performance Poké Ball that provides\na higher success rate for catching Pokémon than\na Great Ball.
ITEMINFO_003	A good, high-performance Poké Ball that provides\na higher success rate for catching Pokémon than\na standard Poké Ball.
ITEMINFO_004	A device for catching wild Pokémon. It’s thrown like\na ball at a Pokémon, comfortably encapsulating\nits target.
ITEMINFO_005	A special Poké Ball used in locales such as the Safari\nZone in the Kanto region and the Great Marsh in the\nSinnoh region.
ITEMINFO_006	A somewhat different Poké Ball that is more effective\nwhen catching Water- or Bug-type Pokémon.
ITEMINFO_007	A somewhat different Poké Ball that is more effective\nwhen catching Pokémon in or on the water.
ITEMINFO_008	A somewhat different Poké Ball that becomes more\neffective the lower the level of the wild Pokémon.
ITEMINFO_009	A somewhat different Poké Ball that is more effective\nwhen catching a Pokémon of a species that you’ve\ncaught before.
ITEMINFO_010	A somewhat different Poké Ball that becomes more\neffective at catching Pokémon the more turns that are\ntaken in battle.
ITEMINFO_011	A particularly comfortable Poké Ball that makes a wild\nPokémon quickly grow friendlier after being caught.
ITEMINFO_012	A somewhat rare Poké Ball made to commemorate a\nspecial occasion of some sort.
ITEMINFO_013	A somewhat different Poké Ball that is more effective\nwhen catching Pokémon at night or in dark places,\nsuch as caves.
ITEMINFO_014	A remedial Poké Ball that restores HP and eliminates\nstatus conditions for a Pokémon caught with it.
ITEMINFO_015	A somewhat different Poké Ball that is more effective\nat catching Pokémon when used first thing in a battle.
ITEMINFO_016	A quite rare Poké Ball made to commemorate a special\noccasion of some sort.
ITEMINFO_017	A spray-type medicine for treating wounds. It can be\nused to restore 20 HP to a Pokémon.
ITEMINFO_018	A spray-type medicine for treating poisoning. It can\nbe used to lift the effects of being poisoned from\na Pokémon.
ITEMINFO_019	A spray-type medicine for treating burns. It can be used\nto cure a Pokémon suffering from a burn.

ITEMINFO_021	A spray-type medicine to wake the sleeping. It can be\nused to rouse a Pokémon from the clutches of sleep.
ITEMINFO_022	A spray-type medicine for treating paralysis. It can be\nused to free a Pokémon that has been paralyzed.

tokuseiinfo_BDSP.dat
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_000	-
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_001	By releasing stench when attacking, this Pokémon\nmay cause the target to flinch.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_002	The Pokémon makes it rain when it enters a battle.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_003	Its Speed stat is boosted every turn.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_004	Hard armor protects the Pokémon from critical hits.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_005	It cannot be knocked out with one hit. One-hit KO\nmoves cannot knock it out, either.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_006	Prevents the use of explosive moves, such as\nSelf-Destruct, by dampening its surroundings.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_007	Its limber body protects the Pokémon from paralysis.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_008	Boosts the Pokémon’s evasiveness in a sandstorm.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_009	The Pokémon is charged with static electricity, so\ncontact with it may cause paralysis.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_010	Restores HP if hit by an Electric-type move instead\nof taking damage.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_011	Restores HP if hit by a Water-type move instead of\ntaking damage.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_012	The Pokémon is oblivious, and that keeps it from\nbeing infatuated or falling for taunts.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_013	Eliminates the effects of weather.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_014	The Pokémon’s compound eyes boost its accuracy.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_015	The Pokémon is suffering from insomnia and cannot\nfall asleep.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_016	The Pokémon’s type becomes the type of the move\nused on it.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_017	The immune system of the Pokémon prevents it from\ngetting poisoned.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_018	Powers up the Pokémon’s Fire-type moves if it’s hit\nby one.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_019	This Pokémon’s dust blocks the additional effects of\nattacks taken.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_020	This Pokémon has its own tempo, and that prevents\nit from becoming confused.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_021	This Pokémon uses suction cups to stay in one spot\nto negate all moves and items that force\nswitching out.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_022	The Pokémon intimidates opposing Pokémon upon\nentering battle, lowering their Attack stat.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_023	This Pokémon steps on the opposing Pokémon’s\nshadow to prevent it from escaping.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_024	This Pokémon inflicts damage with its rough skin\nto the attacker on contact.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_025	Its mysterious power only lets supereffective moves\nhit the Pokémon.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_026	By floating in the air, the Pokémon receives full\nimmunity to all Ground-type moves.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_027	Contact with the Pokémon may inflict poison, sleep,\nor paralysis on its attacker.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_028	The attacker will receive the same status condition if\nit inflicts a burn, poison, or paralysis to the Pokémon.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_029	Prevents other Pokémon’s moves or Abilities from\nlowering the Pokémon’s stats.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_030	All status conditions heal when the Pokémon\nswitches out.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_031	The Pokémon draws in all Electric-type moves.\nInstead of being hit by Electric-type moves,\nit boosts its Sp. Atk.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_032	Boosts the likelihood of additional effects occurring\nwhen attacking.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_033	Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in rain.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_034	Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in harsh sunlight.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_035	Raises the likelihood of meeting wild Pokémon by\nilluminating the surroundings.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_036	When it enters a battle, the Pokémon copies an\nopposing Pokémon’s Ability.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_037	Doubles the Pokémon’s Attack stat.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_038	Contact with the Pokémon may poison the attacker.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_039	The Pokémon’s intensely focused, and that protects\nthe Pokémon from flinching.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_040	The Pokémon is covered with hot magma, which\nprevents the Pokémon from becoming frozen.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_041	The Pokémon is covered with a water veil, which\nprevents the Pokémon from getting a burn.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_042	Prevents Steel-type Pokémon from escaping using\nits magnetic force.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_043	Soundproofing gives the Pokémon full\nimmunity to all sound-based moves.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_044	The Pokémon gradually regains HP in rain.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_045	The Pokémon summons a sandstorm when it enters\na battle.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_046	By putting pressure on the opposing Pokémon, it\nraises their PP usage.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_047	The Pokémon is protected by a layer of thick fat,\nwhich halves the damage taken from Fire- and\nIce-type moves.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_048	The Pokémon awakens from sleep twice as fast\nas other Pokémon.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_049	Contact with the Pokémon may burn the attacker.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_050	Enables a sure getaway from wild Pokémon.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_051	Keen eyes prevent other Pokémon from lowering this\nPokémon’s accuracy.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_052	The Pokémon’s proud of its powerful pincers.\nThey prevent other Pokémon from lowering\nits Attack stat.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_053	The Pokémon may pick up the item an opposing\nPokémon used during a battle. It may pick up items\noutside of battle, too.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_054	The Pokémon can’t use a move if it had used a move\non the previous turn.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_055	Boosts the Attack stat, but lowers accuracy.
TOKUSEIINFO_BDSP_056	Contact with the Pokémon may cause infatuation.

nx_tuucyou_help3_020	If there’s an entry that you’d like to know more about, just scroll\nto it and press the A Button! You’ll be taken to a separate page\nwith more information on the Pokémon you deposited or withdrew!
nx_tuucyou_help3_030	Keep in mind, though, only 300 entries will be saved as records,\neven if you deposit or withdraw a whole bunch of Pokémon\nduring one connection! Older entries will be automatically removed!

wazainfo_all.dat
WAZAINFO_ALL_000	
WAZAINFO_ALL_001	The target is physically pounded with a long tail, a\nforeleg, or the like.
WAZAINFO_ALL_002	The target is attacked with a sharp chop. Critical\nhits land more easily.
WAZAINFO_ALL_003	The target is slapped repeatedly, back and forth,\ntwo to five times in a row.
WAZAINFO_ALL_004	The target is hit with a flurry of punches that strike\ntwo to five times in a row.
WAZAINFO_ALL_005	The target is slugged by a punch thrown with muscle-\npacked power.
WAZAINFO_ALL_006	Coins are hurled at the target to inflict damage.\nMoney is earned after the battle.
WAZAINFO_ALL_007	The target is attacked with a fiery punch. This may also\nleave the target with a burn.
WAZAINFO_ALL_008	The target is attacked with an icy punch. This may also\nleave the target frozen.
WAZAINFO_ALL_009	The target is attacked with an electrified punch. This may\nalso leave the target with paralysis.
WAZAINFO_ALL_010	Hard, pointed, sharp claws rake the target to inflict\ndamage.
WAZAINFO_ALL_011	The target is gripped and squeezed from both sides\nto inflict damage.
WAZAINFO_ALL_012	A vicious tearing attack with big pincers. The target\nfaints instantly if this attack hits.
WAZAINFO_ALL_013	In this two-turn attack, blades of wind hit opposing\nPokémon on the second turn. Critical hits land\nmore easily.
WAZAINFO_ALL_014	A frenetic dance to uplift the fighting spirit. This sharply\nboosts the user’s Attack stat.
WAZAINFO_ALL_015	The target is cut with a scythe, a claw, or the like\nto inflict damage.
WAZAINFO_ALL_016	A gust of wind is whipped up by wings and launched\nat the target to inflict damage.
WAZAINFO_ALL_017	The target is struck with large, imposing wings spread\nwide to inflict damage.
WAZAINFO_ALL_018	The target is blown away, and a different Pokémon is\ndragged out. In the wild, this ends a battle against a\nsingle Pokémon.
WAZAINFO_ALL_019	The user flies up into the sky on the first turn, then\nattacks on the next turn.
WAZAINFO_ALL_020	A long body, tentacles, or the like are used to bind\nand squeeze the target for four to five turns.
WAZAINFO_ALL_021	The target is slammed with a long tail, vines, or the like\nto inflict damage.
WAZAINFO_ALL_022	The target is struck with slender, whiplike vines to\ninflict damage.
WAZAINFO_ALL_023	The user attacks by stomping on the target with a big\nfoot. This may also make the target flinch.
WAZAINFO_ALL_024	The user attacks by kicking the target twice in a row\nusing two feet.
WAZAINFO_ALL_025	The target is attacked by a kick launched with muscle-\npacked power.
WAZAINFO_ALL_026	The user jumps up high, then strikes with a kick.\nIf the kick misses, the user hurts itself.
WAZAINFO_ALL_027	The user lashes out with a quick, spinning kick.\nThis may also make the target flinch.
WAZAINFO_ALL_028	Sand is hurled in the target’s face, lowering the\ntarget’s accuracy.
WAZAINFO_ALL_029	The user sticks out its head and attacks by charging\nstraight into the target. This may also make the\ntarget flinch.
WAZAINFO_ALL_030	The target is jabbed with a sharply pointed horn to\ninflict damage.
WAZAINFO_ALL_031	The user attacks by jabbing the target with a horn,\na beak, or the like. This move hits two to five times\nin a row.
WAZAINFO_ALL_032	The user stabs the target with a horn that rotates like a\ndrill. The target faints instantly if this attack hits.
WAZAINFO_ALL_033	A physical attack in which the user charges and slams\ninto the target with its whole body.
WAZAINFO_ALL_034	The user attacks by dropping onto the target with its\nfull body weight. This may also leave the target with\nparalysis.
WAZAINFO_ALL_035	A long body, vines, or the like are used to wrap and\nsqueeze the target for four to five turns.
WAZAINFO_ALL_036	A reckless full-body charge attack for slamming into\nthe target. This also damages the user a little.
WAZAINFO_ALL_037	The user rampages and attacks for two to three turns.\nThe user then becomes confused.
WAZAINFO_ALL_038	A reckless life-risking tackle in which the user rushes\nthe target. This also damages the user quite a lot.
WAZAINFO_ALL_039	The user wags its tail cutely, making opposing Pokémon\nless wary. This lowers their Defense stats.
WAZAINFO_ALL_040	The user stabs the target with a poisonous stinger to\ninflict damage. This may also poison the target.
WAZAINFO_ALL_041	The user damages the target twice in succession\nby jabbing it with two spikes. This may also poison\nthe target.
WAZAINFO_ALL_042	The user attacks by shooting sharp spikes at the target.\nThis move hits two to five times in a row.
WAZAINFO_ALL_043	The user gives opposing Pokémon an intimidating leer\nthat lowers their Defense stats.
WAZAINFO_ALL_044	The target is bitten with viciously sharp fangs. This may\nalso make the target flinch.
WAZAINFO_ALL_045	The user growls in an endearing way, making opposing\nPokémon less wary. This lowers their Attack stats.
WAZAINFO_ALL_046	The target is scared off, and a different Pokémon is\ndragged out. In the wild, this ends a battle against a\nsingle Pokémon.
WAZAINFO_ALL_047	A soothing lullaby is sung in a beautiful voice that puts\nthe target to sleep.
WAZAINFO_ALL_048	The user generates odd sound waves from its body\nthat confuse the target.
WAZAINFO_ALL_049	The target is hit with a destructive shock wave that\nalways inflicts 20 HP damage.
WAZAINFO_ALL_050	For four turns, the target will be unable to use whichever\nmove it last used.
WAZAINFO_ALL_051	Opposing Pokémon are attacked with a spray of harsh\nacid. This may also lower their Sp. Def stats.
WAZAINFO_ALL_052	The target is attacked with small flames. This may also\nleave the target with a burn.
WAZAINFO_ALL_053	The target is scorched with an intense blast of fire.\nThis may also leave the target with a burn.
WAZAINFO_ALL_054	The user cloaks itself and its allies in a white mist\nthat prevents any of their stats from being lowered\nfor five turns.
WAZAINFO_ALL_055	The target is blasted with a forceful shot of water.
WAZAINFO_ALL_056	The target is blasted by a huge volume of water\nlaunched under great pressure.
WAZAINFO_ALL_057	The user attacks everything around it by swamping\nits surroundings with a giant wave.
WAZAINFO_ALL_058	The target is struck with an icy-cold beam of energy.\nThis may also leave the target frozen.
WAZAINFO_ALL_059	A howling blizzard is summoned to strike opposing\nPokémon. This may also leave the opposing Pokémon\nfrozen.
WAZAINFO_ALL_060	The target is attacked with a peculiar ray. This may also\nconfuse the target.

WAZAINFO_SWSH_769	This is a Psychic-type attack Dynamax Pokémon use.\nThe user turns the ground into Psychic Terrain for\nfive turns.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_770	This is a Rock-type attack Dynamax Pokémon use.\nThe user summons a sandstorm lasting five turns.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_771	This is a Ground-type attack Dynamax Pokémon use.\nThis raises ally Pokémon’s Sp. Def stats.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_772	This is a Dark-type attack Dynamax Pokémon use.\nThis lowers the target’s Sp. Def stat.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_773	This is a Grass-type attack Dynamax Pokémon use.\nThe user turns the ground into Grassy Terrain for\nfive turns.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_774	This is a Steel-type attack Dynamax Pokémon use.\nThis raises ally Pokémon’s Defense stats.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_775	The user raises all its stats by using some of its HP.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_776	The user attacks by slamming its body into the target.\nThe higher the user’s Defense, the more damage it can\ninflict on the target.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_777	The user sharply raises the target’s Attack and Sp. Atk\nstats by decorating the target.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_778	The user plays its drum, controlling the drum’s roots\nto attack the target. This also lowers the target’s\nSpeed stat.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_779	The user snares the target in a snap trap for four to\nfive turns.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_780	The user attacks by igniting a small stone and launching\nit as a fiery ball at the target. This may also leave the\ntarget with a burn.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_781	The user becomes a gigantic sword and cuts the target.\nThis move deals twice the damage if the target\nis Dynamaxed.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_782	The user becomes a gigantic shield and slams into\nthe target. This move deals twice the damage if the\ntarget is Dynamaxed.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_783	Morpeko attacks and raises its Speed with the energy\nstored in its cheeks. This move’s type changes\ndepending on the user’s form.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_784	The user swings its tough tail wildly and attacks\nopposing Pokémon. This also lowers their Attack stats.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_785	The user attacks the target by poking it with a sharply\npointed branch.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_786	The user attacks opposing Pokémon by twanging\na guitar or bass guitar, causing a huge echo and\nstrong vibration.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_787	The user attacks the target with an acidic liquid created\nfrom tart apples. This also lowers the target’s\nSp. Def stat.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_788	The user inflicts damage by dropping an apple from\nhigh above. This also lowers the target’s Defense stat.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_789	The user attacks the target with so much force that it\ncould break the target’s spirit. This also lowers the\ntarget’s Sp. Atk stat.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_790	The user attacks the target by emitting steam.\nThis may also confuse the target.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_791	The user scatters mysterious water around and restores\nthe HP of itself and its ally Pokémon in the battle.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_792	This move enables the user to protect itself from all attacks.\nIts chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.\nDirect contact harshly lowers the attacker’s Defense stat.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_793	The user pretends to bow its head, but then it stabs the\ntarget with its disheveled hair. This attack never misses.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_794	The user attacks wildly with its thick leek.\nThe user can’t move on the next turn, because the\nforce of this move makes it stagger.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_795	This is Eternatus’s most powerful attack in its original\nform. The user can’t move on the next turn.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_796	The user fires a beam of steel that it collected from its\nentire body. This also damages the user.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_797	The user attacks the target with its psychic power.\nThis move’s power goes up and damages all opposing\nPokémon on Psychic Terrain.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_798	The user attacks while destroying the terrain. This move\nfails when the ground hasn’t turned into a terrain.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_799	The user attacks by shooting scales two to five times\nin a row. This move boosts the user’s Speed stat but\nlowers its Defense stat.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_800	In this two-turn attack, the user gathers space power\nand boosts its Sp. Atk stat, then attacks the target\non the next turn.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_801	This move inflicts physical or special damage,\nwhichever will be more effective. This may also poison\nthe target.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_802	The user attacks everything around it and faints upon\nusing this move. This move’s power is increased on\nMisty Terrain.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_803	Gliding on the ground, the user attacks the target.\nThis move always goes first on Grassy Terrain.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_804	The user attacks with electric voltage rising from\nthe ground. This move’s power doubles when the target\nis on Electric Terrain.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_805	The user utilizes the power of the terrain to attack.\nThis move’s type and power changes depending on\nthe terrain when it’s used.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_806	The user skitters behind the target to attack. This also\nlowers the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_807	The user attacks with energy from jealousy. This leaves\nall opposing Pokémon that have had their stats boosted\nduring the turn with a burn.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_808	The user lashes out to vent its frustration toward\nthe target. If the user’s stats were lowered during this\nturn, the power of this move is doubled.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_809	The user attacks the target by controlling the target’s\nitem. The move fails if the target doesn’t have an item.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_810	The user surrounds everything around it with\nhighly acidic gas and melts away items they hold.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_811	The user properly coaches its ally Pokémon,\nboosting their Attack and Defense stats.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_812	After making its attack, the user rushes back to\nswitch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_813	A consecutive three-kick attack that becomes more\npowerful with each successful hit.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_814	The user slams the target with its wings.\nThe target is hit twice in a row.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_815	The user throws scorching sand at the target to attack.\nThis may also leave the target with a burn.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_816	The user becomes one with the jungle, restoring HP\nand healing any status conditions of itself and its ally\nPokémon in battle.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_817	The user, having mastered the Dark style, strikes the\ntarget with a fierce blow. This attack always results\nin a critical hit.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_818	The user, having mastered the Water style, strikes the\ntarget with a flowing motion three times in a row. This\nattack always results in a critical hit.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_819	The user traps the target in a cage of sparking\nelectricity for four to five turns.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_820	Converting its life-force into power, the user attacks\nopposing Pokémon. The lower the user’s HP, the lower\nthe move’s power.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_821	The user shoots its psychic power from its eyes\nto attack. This may also leave the target frozen.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_822	The user transforms its wrath into a fire-like aura\nto attack. This may also make opposing Pokémon flinch.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_823	The user overwhelms the target with lightning-like\nmovement before delivering a kick. This also lowers\nthe target’s Defense stat.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_824	The user attacks by hurling a blizzard-cloaked\nicicle lance at opposing Pokémon.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_825	The user attacks by sending a frightful amount of small\nghosts at opposing Pokémon.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_826	The user attacks with its tremendous psychic power.\nThis also removes 3 PP from the target’s last move.
