zukan_comment_alpha.dat
ZKN_ALPHA_000_000	
ZKN_ALPHA_001_000	Bulbasaur can be seen napping in bright sunlight.\nThere is a seed on its back. By soaking up the sun’s rays,\nthe seed grows progressively larger.
ZKN_ALPHA_002_000	There is a bud on this Pokémon’s back. To support its weight,\nIvysaur’s legs and trunk grow thick and strong.\nIf it starts spending more time lying in the sunlight,\nit’s a sign that the bud will bloom into a large flower soon.
ZKN_ALPHA_003_000	There is a large flower on Venusaur’s back. The flower is said\nto take on vivid colors if it gets plenty of nutrition and sunlight.\nThe flower’s aroma soothes the emotions of people.
ZKN_ALPHA_004_000	The flame that burns at the tip of its tail is an indication\nof its emotions. The flame wavers when Charmander\nis enjoying itself. If the Pokémon becomes enraged,\nthe flame burns fiercely.
ZKN_ALPHA_005_000	Charmeleon mercilessly destroys its foes using its sharp\nclaws. If it encounters a strong foe, it turns aggressive.\nIn this excited state, the flame at the tip of its tail flares with\na bluish white color.
ZKN_ALPHA_006_000	Charizard flies around the sky in search of powerful opponents.\nIt breathes fire of such great heat that it melts anything.\nHowever, it never turns its fiery breath on any opponent\nweaker than itself.
ZKN_ALPHA_007_000	Squirtle’s shell is not merely used for protection.\nThe shell’s rounded shape and the grooves on its\nsurface help minimize resistance in water,\nenabling this Pokémon to swim at high speeds.
ZKN_ALPHA_008_000	Its tail is large and covered with a rich, thick fur. The tail\nbecomes increasingly deeper in color as Wartortle ages.\nThe scratches on its shell are evidence of this Pokémon’s\ntoughness as a battler.
ZKN_ALPHA_009_000	Blastoise has water spouts that protrude from its shell.\nThe water spouts are very accurate.\nThey can shoot bullets of water with enough accuracy\nto strike empty cans from a distance of over 160 feet.
ZKN_ALPHA_010_000	Caterpie has a voracious appetite. It can devour leaves\nbigger than its body right before your eyes. From its antenna,\nthis Pokémon releases a terrifically strong odor.
ZKN_ALPHA_011_000	The shell covering this Pokémon’s body is as hard as an\niron slab. Metapod does not move very much.\nIt stays still because it is preparing its soft innards for\nevolution inside the hard shell.
ZKN_ALPHA_012_000	Butterfree has a superior ability to search for delicious honey\nfrom flowers. It can even search out, extract, and carry honey\nfrom flowers that are blooming over six miles from its nest.
ZKN_ALPHA_013_000	Weedle has an extremely acute sense of smell. It is capable\nof distinguishing its favorite kinds of leaves from those it\ndislikes just by sniffing with its big red proboscis (nose).
ZKN_ALPHA_014_000	Kakuna remains virtually immobile as it clings to a tree.\nHowever, on the inside, it is extremely busy as it prepares\nfor its coming evolution.\nThis is evident from how hot the shell becomes to the touch.
ZKN_ALPHA_015_000	Beedrill is extremely territorial. No one should ever approach\nits nest—this is for their own safety. If angered, they will attack\nin a furious swarm.
ZKN_ALPHA_016_000	Pidgey has an extremely sharp sense of direction.\nIt is capable of unerringly returning home to its nest,\nhowever far it may be removed from its familiar surroundings.
ZKN_ALPHA_017_000	Pidgeotto claims a large area as its own territory. This\nPokémon flies around, patrolling its living space. If its territory\nis violated, it shows no mercy in thoroughly punishing the foe\nwith its sharp claws.
ZKN_ALPHA_018_000	This Pokémon has a dazzling plumage of beautifully\nglossy feathers. Many Trainers are captivated by the\nstriking beauty of the feathers on its head, compelling\nthem to choose Pidgeot as their Pokémon.
ZKN_ALPHA_019_000	Rattata is cautious in the extreme. Even while it is asleep,\nit constantly listens by moving its ears around. It is not\npicky about where it lives—it will make its nest anywhere.
ZKN_ALPHA_020_000	Raticate’s sturdy fangs grow steadily. To keep them\nground down, it gnaws on rocks and logs. It may\neven chew on the walls of houses.
ZKN_ALPHA_021_000	Spearow has a very loud cry that can be heard over\nhalf a mile away. If its high, keening cry is heard echoing all\naround, it is a sign that they are warning each other of danger.
ZKN_ALPHA_022_000	Fearow is recognized by its long neck and elongated beak.\nThey are conveniently shaped for catching prey in soil or\nwater. It deftly moves its long and skinny beak to pluck prey.
ZKN_ALPHA_023_000	Ekans curls itself up in a spiral while it rests. Assuming this\nposition allows it to quickly respond to a threat from any\ndirection with a glare from its upraised head.
ZKN_ALPHA_024_000	This Pokémon is terrifically strong in order to constrict things\nwith its body. It can even flatten steel oil drums. Once Arbok\nwraps its body around its foe, escaping its crunching embrace\nis impossible.
ZKN_ALPHA_025_000	This Pokémon has electricity-storing pouches on its cheeks.\nThese appear to become electrically charged during the night\nwhile Pikachu sleeps. It occasionally discharges electricity\nwhen it is dozy after waking up.
ZKN_ALPHA_026_000	This Pokémon exudes a weak electrical charge from all over\nits body that makes it take on a slight glow in darkness.\nRaichu plants its tail in the ground to discharge electricity.
ZKN_ALPHA_027_000	Sandshrew has a very dry hide that is extremely tough.\nThe Pokémon can roll into a ball that repels any attack.\nAt night, it burrows into the desert sand to sleep.
ZKN_ALPHA_028_000	Sandslash can roll up its body as if it were a ball covered\nwith large spikes. In battle, this Pokémon will try to make\nthe foe flinch by jabbing it with its spines. It then leaps at\nthe stunned foe to tear wildly with its sharp claws.
ZKN_ALPHA_029_000	Nidoran♀ has barbs that secrete a powerful poison.\nThey are thought to have developed as protection for\nthis small-bodied Pokémon. When enraged, it releases\na horrible toxin from its horn.
ZKN_ALPHA_030_000	When Nidorina are with their friends or family, they keep\ntheir barbs tucked away to prevent hurting each other.\nThis Pokémon appears to become nervous if separated\nfrom the others.
ZKN_ALPHA_031_000	Nidoqueen’s body is encased in extremely hard scales.\nIt is adept at sending foes flying with harsh tackles. This\nPokémon is at its strongest when it is defending its young.
ZKN_ALPHA_032_000	Nidoran♂ has developed muscles for moving its ears. Thanks\nto them, the ears can be freely moved in any direction. Even\nthe slightest sound does not escape this Pokémon’s notice.
ZKN_ALPHA_033_000	Nidorino has a horn that is harder than a diamond. If it senses\na hostile presence, all the barbs on its back bristle up at once,\nand it challenges the foe with all its might.
ZKN_ALPHA_034_000	Nidoking’s thick tail packs enormously destructive power.\nWith one swing, it can topple a metal transmission tower. Once\nthis Pokémon goes on a rampage, there is no stopping it.
ZKN_ALPHA_035_000	On every night of a full moon, groups of this Pokémon\ncome out to play. When dawn arrives, the tired Clefairy\nreturn to their quiet mountain retreats and go to sleep\nnestled up against each other.
ZKN_ALPHA_036_000	Clefable moves by skipping lightly as if it were flying using\nits wings. Its bouncy step lets it even walk on water.\nIt is known to take strolls on lakes on quiet, moonlit nights.
ZKN_ALPHA_037_000	Inside Vulpix’s body burns a flame that never goes out.\nDuring the daytime, when the temperatures rise, this\nPokémon releases flames from its mouth to prevent its\nbody from growing too hot.
ZKN_ALPHA_038_000	Legend has it that Ninetales came into being when\nnine wizards possessing sacred powers merged into one.\nThis Pokémon is highly intelligent—it can understand\nhuman speech.
ZKN_ALPHA_039_000	When this Pokémon sings, it never pauses to breathe.\nIf it is in a battle against an opponent that does not easily\nfall asleep, Jigglypuff cannot breathe, endangering its life.
ZKN_ALPHA_040_000	Wigglytuff’s body is very flexible. By inhaling deeply,\nthis Pokémon can inflate itself seemingly without end.\nOnce inflated, Wigglytuff bounces along lightly like a balloon.
ZKN_ALPHA_041_000	Zubat avoids sunlight because exposure causes it to become\nunhealthy. During the daytime, it stays in caves or under\nthe eaves of old houses, sleeping while hanging upside down.
ZKN_ALPHA_042_000	Golbat bites down on prey with its four fangs and drinks\nthe victim’s blood. It becomes active on inky dark\nmoonless nights, flying around to attack people and Pokémon.
ZKN_ALPHA_043_000	Oddish searches for fertile, nutrient-rich soil, then plants itself.\nDuring the daytime, while it is planted, this Pokémon’s feet\nare thought to change shape and become similar to the roots\nof trees.
ZKN_ALPHA_044_000	From its mouth Gloom drips honey that smells absolutely\nhorrible. Apparently, it loves the horrid stench. It sniffs the\nnoxious fumes and then drools even more of its honey.
ZKN_ALPHA_045_000	Vileplume has the world’s largest petals. They are used to\nattract prey that are then doused with toxic spores. Once the\nprey are immobilized, this Pokémon catches and devours them.
ZKN_ALPHA_046_000	Paras has parasitic mushrooms growing on its back called\ntochukaso. They grow large by drawing nutrients from this\nBug Pokémon host. They are highly valued as a medicine\nfor extending life.
ZKN_ALPHA_047_000	Parasect is known to infest large trees en masse and drain\nnutrients from the lower trunk and roots. When an infested\ntree dies, they move onto another tree all at once.
ZKN_ALPHA_048_000	Venonat is said to have evolved with a coat of thin, stiff hair\nthat covers its entire body for protection. It possesses large\neyes that never fail to spot even minuscule prey.
ZKN_ALPHA_049_000	Venomoth is nocturnal—it is a Pokémon that only becomes\nactive at night. Its favorite prey are small insects that gather\naround streetlights, attracted by the light in the darkness.
ZKN_ALPHA_050_000	Diglett are raised in most farms. The reason is simple—\nwherever this Pokémon burrows, the soil is left perfectly tilled\nfor planting crops. This soil is made ideal for growing\ndelicious vegetables.
ZKN_ALPHA_051_000	Dugtrio are actually triplets that emerged from one body.\nAs a result, each triplet thinks exactly like the other two\ntriplets. They work cooperatively to burrow endlessly.
ZKN_ALPHA_052_000	Meowth withdraws its sharp claws into its paws to slinkily sneak\nabout without making any incriminating footsteps. For some\nreason, this Pokémon loves shiny coins that glitter with light.
ZKN_ALPHA_053_000	Persian has six bold whiskers that give it a look of toughness.\nThe whiskers sense air movements to determine what is in the\nPokémon’s surrounding vicinity. It becomes docile if grabbed\nby the whiskers.
ZKN_ALPHA_054_000	If it uses its mysterious power, Psyduck can’t remember\nhaving done so. It apparently can’t form a memory of such\nan event because it goes into an altered state that is much\nlike deep sleep.
ZKN_ALPHA_055_000	Golduck is the fastest swimmer among all Pokémon. It swims\neffortlessly, even in a rough, stormy sea. It sometimes rescues\npeople from wrecked ships floundering in high seas.
ZKN_ALPHA_056_000	When Mankey starts shaking and its nasal breathing turns\nrough, it’s a sure sign that it is becoming angry. However,\nbecause it goes into a towering rage almost instantly,\nit is impossible for anyone to flee its wrath.
ZKN_ALPHA_057_000	When Primeape becomes furious, its blood circulation\nis boosted. In turn, its muscles are made even stronger.\nHowever, it also becomes much less intelligent at the\nsame time.
ZKN_ALPHA_058_000	Growlithe has a superb sense of smell. Once it smells anything,\nthis Pokémon won’t forget the scent, no matter what. It uses\nits advanced olfactory sense to determine the emotions of\nother living things.
ZKN_ALPHA_059_000	Arcanine is known for its high speed. It is said to be capable\nof running over 6,200 miles in a single day and night. The\nfire that blazes wildly within this Pokémon’s body is its source\nof power.
ZKN_ALPHA_060_000	Poliwag has a very thin skin. It is possible to see the\nPokémon’s spiral innards right through the skin. Despite its\nthinness, however, the skin is also very flexible. Even sharp\nfangs bounce right off it.
ZKN_ALPHA_061_000	The surface of Poliwhirl’s body is always wet and slick with\na slimy fluid. Because of this slippery covering, it can easily\nslip and slide out of the clutches of any enemy in battle.
ZKN_ALPHA_062_000	Poliwrath’s highly developed, brawny muscles never grow\nfatigued, however much it exercises. It is so tirelessly strong,\nthis Pokémon can swim back and forth across the ocean\nwithout effort.
ZKN_ALPHA_063_000	Abra needs to sleep for eighteen hours a day. If it doesn’t,\nthis Pokémon loses its ability to use telekinetic powers. If it is\nattacked, Abra escapes using Teleport while it is still sleeping.
ZKN_ALPHA_064_000	Kadabra holds a silver spoon in its hand. The spoon is used\nto amplify the alpha waves in its brain. Without the spoon, the\nPokémon is said to be limited to half the usual amount of its\ntelekinetic powers.
ZKN_ALPHA_065_000	Alakazam’s brain continually grows, infinitely multiplying\nbrain cells. This amazing brain gives this Pokémon an\nastoundingly high IQ of 5,000. It has a thorough memory\nof everything that has occurred in the world.
ZKN_ALPHA_066_000	Machop exercises by hefting around a Graveler as if it were\na barbell. There are some Machop that travel the world in a\nquest to master all kinds of martial arts.
ZKN_ALPHA_067_000	Machoke undertakes bodybuilding every day even as\nit helps people with tough, physically demanding labor.\nOn its days off, this Pokémon heads to the fields and\nmountains to exercise and train.
ZKN_ALPHA_068_000	Machamp is known as the Pokémon that has mastered\nevery kind of martial arts. If it grabs hold of the foe with its\nfour arms, the battle is all but over. The hapless foe is thrown\nfar over the horizon.
ZKN_ALPHA_069_000	Bellsprout’s thin and flexible body lets it bend and sway\nto avoid any attack, however strong it may be. From its mouth,\nthis Pokémon spits a corrosive fluid that melts even iron.
ZKN_ALPHA_070_000	Weepinbell has a large hook on its rear end. At night, the\nPokémon hooks on to a tree branch and goes to sleep.\nIf it moves around in its sleep, it may wake up to find itself\non the ground.
ZKN_ALPHA_071_000	Victreebel has a long vine that extends from its head.\nThis vine is waved and flicked about as if it were an animal\nto attract prey. When an unsuspecting prey draws near,\nthis Pokémon swallows it whole.
ZKN_ALPHA_072_000	Tentacool absorbs sunlight and refracts it using water inside\nits body to convert it into beam energy. This Pokémon shoots\nbeams from the small round organ above its eyes.
ZKN_ALPHA_073_000	Tentacruel has tentacles that can be freely elongated\nand shortened at will. It ensnares prey with its tentacles\nand weakens the prey by dosing it with a harsh toxin.\nIt can catch up to 80 prey at the same time.
ZKN_ALPHA_074_000	When Geodude sleeps deeply, it buries itself halfway into the\nground. It will not awaken even if hikers step on it unwittingly.\nIn the morning, this Pokémon rolls downhill in search of food.
ZKN_ALPHA_075_000	Rocks are Graveler’s favorite food. This Pokémon will climb a\nmountain from the base to the summit, crunchingly feasting on\nrocks all the while. Upon reaching the peak, it rolls back down\nto the bottom.
ZKN_ALPHA_076_000	Golem is known for rolling down from mountains. To prevent\nthem from rolling into the homes of people downhill, grooves\nhave been dug into the sides of mountains to serve as\nguideways for diverting this Pokémon’s course.
ZKN_ALPHA_077_000	Ponyta is very weak at birth. It can barely stand up.\nThis Pokémon becomes stronger by stumbling and\nfalling to keep up with its parent.
ZKN_ALPHA_078_000	Rapidash usually can be seen casually cantering in the fields\nand plains. However, when this Pokémon turns serious, its\nfiery manes flare and blaze as it gallops its way up to 150 mph.
ZKN_ALPHA_079_000	Slowpoke uses its tail to catch prey by dipping it in water\nat the side of a river. However, this Pokémon often forgets\nwhat it’s doing and often spends entire days just loafing\nat water’s edge.
ZKN_ALPHA_080_000	Slowbro’s tail has a Shellder firmly attached with a bite.\nAs a result, the tail can’t be used for fishing anymore. This\ncauses Slowbro to grudgingly swim and catch prey instead.
ZKN_ALPHA_081_000	Magnemite floats in the air by emitting electromagnetic waves\nfrom the units at its sides. These waves block gravity. This\nPokémon becomes incapable of flight if its internal electrical\nsupply is depleted.
ZKN_ALPHA_082_000	Magneton emits a powerful magnetic force that is fatal to\nelectronics and precision instruments. Because of this, it is\nsaid that some towns warn people to keep this Pokémon\ninside a Poké Ball.
ZKN_ALPHA_083_000	Farfetch’d is always seen with a stalk from a plant of some\nsort. Apparently, there are good stalks and bad stalks. This\nPokémon has been known to fight with others over stalks.
ZKN_ALPHA_084_000	Doduo’s two heads contain completely identical brains. A\nscientific study reported that on rare occasions, there will be\nexamples of this Pokémon possessing different sets of brains.
ZKN_ALPHA_085_000	Apparently, the heads aren’t the only parts of the body that\nDodrio has three of. It has three sets of hearts and lungs as\nwell, so it is capable of running long distances without rest.
ZKN_ALPHA_086_000	Seel hunts for prey in the frigid sea underneath sheets of ice.\nWhen it needs to breathe, it punches a hole through the ice\nwith the sharply protruding section of its head.
ZKN_ALPHA_087_000	Dewgong loves to snooze on bitterly cold ice. The sight of\nthis Pokémon sleeping on a glacier was mistakenly thought\nto be a mermaid by a mariner long ago.
ZKN_ALPHA_088_000	Grimer emerged from the sludge that settled on a polluted\nseabed. This Pokémon loves anything filthy. It constantly\nleaks a horribly germ-infested fluid from all over its body.
ZKN_ALPHA_089_000	This Pokémon’s favorite food is anything that is repugnantly\nfilthy. In dirty towns where people think nothing of throwing\naway litter on the streets, Muk are certain to gather.
ZKN_ALPHA_090_000	At night, this Pokémon uses its broad tongue to burrow a hole\nin the seafloor sand and then sleep in it. While it is sleeping,\nShellder closes its shell, but leaves its tongue hanging out.
ZKN_ALPHA_091_000	Cloyster is capable of swimming in the sea. It does so by\nswallowing water, then jetting it out toward the rear. This\nPokémon shoots spikes from its shell using the same system.
ZKN_ALPHA_092_000	Gastly is largely composed of gaseous matter. When exposed\nto a strong wind, the gaseous body quickly dwindles away.\nGroups of this Pokémon cluster under the eaves of houses to\nescape the ravages of wind.
ZKN_ALPHA_093_000	Haunter is a dangerous Pokémon. If one beckons you while\nfloating in darkness, you must never approach it. This Pokémon\nwill try to lick you with its tongue and steal your life away.
ZKN_ALPHA_094_000	Sometimes, on a dark night, your shadow thrown by a\nstreetlight will suddenly and startlingly overtake you.\nIt is actually a Gengar running past you, pretending to be\nyour shadow.
ZKN_ALPHA_095_000	Onix has a magnet in its brain. It acts as a compass so that\nthis Pokémon does not lose direction while it is tunneling.\nAs it grows older, its body becomes increasingly rounder\nand smoother.
ZKN_ALPHA_096_000	If your nose becomes itchy while you are sleeping, it’s a sure\nsign that one of these Pokémon is standing above your pillow\nand trying to eat your dream through your nostrils.
ZKN_ALPHA_097_000	Hypno holds a pendulum in its hand. The arcing movement and\nglitter of the pendulum lull the foe into a deep state of\nhypnosis. While this Pokémon searches for prey, it polishes\nthe pendulum.
ZKN_ALPHA_098_000	Krabby live on beaches, burrowed inside holes dug into\nthe sand. On sandy beaches with little in the way of food,\nthese Pokémon can be seen squabbling with each other\nover territory.
ZKN_ALPHA_099_000	Kingler has an enormous, oversized claw. It waves this huge\nclaw in the air to communicate with others. However, because\nthe claw is so heavy, the Pokémon quickly tires.
ZKN_ALPHA_100_000	Voltorb is extremely sensitive—it explodes at the slightest\nof shocks. It is rumored that it was first created when a\nPoké Ball was exposed to a powerful pulse of energy.
ZKN_ALPHA_101_000	One of Electrode’s characteristics is its attraction to electricity.\nIt is a problematical Pokémon that congregates mostly at\nelectrical power plants to feed on electricity that has just\nbeen generated.
ZKN_ALPHA_102_000	This Pokémon consists of six eggs that form a closely knit\ncluster. The six eggs attract each other and spin around.\nWhen cracks increasingly appear on the eggs, Exeggcute is\nclose to evolution.
ZKN_ALPHA_103_000	Exeggutor originally came from the tropics. Its heads\nsteadily grow larger from exposure to strong sunlight. It is\nsaid that when the heads fall off, they group together to\nform Exeggcute.
ZKN_ALPHA_104_000	Cubone pines for the mother it will never see again. Seeing a\nlikeness of its mother in the full moon, it cries. The stains on\nthe skull the Pokémon wears are made by the tears it sheds.
ZKN_ALPHA_105_000	Marowak is the evolved form of a Cubone that has overcome\nits sadness at the loss of its mother and grown tough. This\nPokémon’s tempered and hardened spirit is not easily broken.
ZKN_ALPHA_106_000	Hitmonlee’s legs freely contract and stretch. Using these\nspringlike legs, it bowls over foes with devastating kicks.\nAfter battle, it rubs down its legs and loosens the muscles\nto overcome fatigue.
ZKN_ALPHA_107_000	Hitmonchan is said to possess the spirit of a boxer who had\nbeen working toward a world championship. This Pokémon\nhas an indomitable spirit and will never give up in the face\nof adversity.
ZKN_ALPHA_108_000	Whenever Lickitung comes across something new, it will\nunfailingly give it a lick. It does so because it memorizes things\nby texture and by taste. It is somewhat put off by sour things.
ZKN_ALPHA_109_000	Koffing embodies toxic substances. It mixes the toxins with raw\ngarbage to set off a chemical reaction that results in a terribly\npowerful poison gas. The higher the temperature, the more gas\nis concocted by this Pokémon.
ZKN_ALPHA_110_000	Weezing alternately shrinks and inflates its twin bodies to mix\ntogether toxic gases inside. The more the gases are mixed,\nthe more powerful the toxins become. The Pokémon also\nbecomes more putrid.
ZKN_ALPHA_111_000	Rhyhorn’s brain is very small. It is so dense, while on a run\nit forgets why it started running in the first place. It apparently\nremembers sometimes if it demolishes something.
ZKN_ALPHA_112_000	Rhydon has a horn that serves as a drill. It is used for\ndestroying rocks and boulders. This Pokémon occasionally\nrams into streams of magma, but the armor-like hide prevents\nit from feeling the heat.
ZKN_ALPHA_113_000	Chansey lays nutritionally excellent eggs on an everyday basis.\nThe eggs are so delicious, they are easily and eagerly\ndevoured by even those people who have lost their appetite.
ZKN_ALPHA_114_000	Tangela’s vines snap off easily if they are grabbed. This\nhappens without pain, allowing it to make a quick getaway.\nThe lost vines are replaced by newly grown vines the very\nnext day.
ZKN_ALPHA_115_000	If you come across a young Kangaskhan playing by itself,\nyou must never disturb it or attempt to catch it. The baby\nPokémon’s parent is sure to be in the area, and it will\nbecome violently enraged at you.
ZKN_ALPHA_116_000	If Horsea senses danger, it will reflexively spray a dense\nblack ink from its mouth and try to escape. This Pokémon\nswims by cleverly flapping the fin on its back.
ZKN_ALPHA_117_000	Seadra generates whirlpools by spinning its body.\nThe whirlpools are strong enough to swallow even\nfishing boats. This Pokémon weakens prey with\nthese currents, then swallows it whole.
ZKN_ALPHA_118_000	Goldeen loves swimming wild and free in rivers and ponds.\nIf one of these Pokémon is placed in an aquarium, it will\nshatter even the thickest glass with one ram of its horn\nand make its escape.
ZKN_ALPHA_119_000	Seaking is very protective of its eggs. The male and female\nwill take turns patrolling around their nest and eggs. The\nguarding of eggs by these Pokémon goes on for over a month.
ZKN_ALPHA_120_000	Staryu apparently communicates with the stars in the night sky\nby flashing the red core at the center of its body. If parts of its\nbody are torn, this Pokémon simply regenerates the missing\npieces and limbs.
ZKN_ALPHA_121_000	Starmie swims through water by spinning its star-shaped\nbody as if it were a propeller on a ship. The core at the\ncenter of this Pokémon’s body glows in seven colors.
ZKN_ALPHA_122_000	Mr. Mime is a master of pantomime. Its gestures and motions\nconvince watchers that something unseeable actually exists.\nOnce the watchers are convinced, the unseeable thing exists\nas if it were real.
ZKN_ALPHA_123_000	Scyther is blindingly fast. Its blazing speed enhances the\neffectiveness of the twin scythes on its forearms. This\nPokémon’s scythes are so effective, they can slice through\nthick logs in one wicked stroke.
ZKN_ALPHA_124_000	Jynx walks rhythmically, swaying and shaking its hips\nas if it were dancing. Its motions are so bouncingly alluring,\npeople seeing it are compelled to shake their hips without\ngiving any thought to what they are doing.
ZKN_ALPHA_125_000	When a storm arrives, gangs of this Pokémon compete with\neach other to scale heights that are likely to be stricken by\nlightning bolts. Some towns use Electabuzz in place of\nlightning rods.
ZKN_ALPHA_126_000	In battle, Magmar blows out intensely hot flames from\nall over its body to intimidate its opponent. This Pokémon’s\nfiery bursts create heat waves that ignite grass and trees in\nits surroundings.
ZKN_ALPHA_127_000	Pinsir has a pair of massive horns. Protruding from the surface\nof these horns are thorns. These thorns are driven deeply into\nthe foe’s body when the pincer closes, making it tough for the\nfoe to escape.
ZKN_ALPHA_128_000	This Pokémon is not satisfied unless it is rampaging at all\ntimes. If there is no opponent for Tauros to battle, it will\ncharge at thick trees and knock them down to calm itself.
ZKN_ALPHA_129_000	Magikarp is virtually useless in battle as it can only splash\naround. As a result, it is considered to be weak. However,\nit is actually a very hardy Pokémon that can survive in any\nbody of water no matter how polluted it is.
ZKN_ALPHA_130_000	Once Gyarados goes on a rampage, its ferociously violent\nblood doesn’t calm until it has burned everything down.\nThere are records of this Pokémon’s rampages lasting a\nwhole month.
ZKN_ALPHA_131_000	People have driven Lapras almost to the point of extinction.\nIn the evenings, this Pokémon is said to sing plaintively as\nit seeks what few others of its kind still remain.
ZKN_ALPHA_132_000	Ditto rearranges its cell structure to transform itself into other\nshapes. However, if it tries to transform itself into something\nby relying on its memory, this Pokémon manages to get\ndetails wrong.
ZKN_ALPHA_133_000	Eevee has an unstable genetic makeup that suddenly mutates\ndue to the environment in which it lives. Radiation from various\nstones causes this Pokémon to evolve.
ZKN_ALPHA_134_000	Vaporeon underwent a spontaneous mutation and grew fins\nand gills that allow it to live underwater. This Pokémon has\nthe ability to freely control water.
ZKN_ALPHA_135_000	Jolteon’s cells generate a low level of electricity. This power\nis amplified by the static electricity of its fur, enabling the\nPokémon to drop thunderbolts. The bristling fur is made of\nelectrically charged needles.
ZKN_ALPHA_136_000	Flareon’s fluffy fur has a functional purpose—it releases heat\ninto the air so that its body does not get excessively hot.\nThis Pokémon’s body temperature can rise to a maximum of\n1,650 degrees Fahrenheit.
ZKN_ALPHA_137_000	Porygon is capable of reverting itself entirely back to program\ndata and entering cyberspace. This Pokémon is copy protected\nso it cannot be duplicated by copying.
ZKN_ALPHA_138_000	Omanyte is one of the ancient and long-since-extinct Pokémon\nthat have been regenerated from fossils by people. If attacked\nby an enemy, it withdraws itself inside its hard shell.
ZKN_ALPHA_139_000	Omastar uses its tentacles to capture its prey. It is\nbelieved to have become extinct because its shell grew too\nlarge and heavy, causing its movements to become too slow\nand ponderous.
ZKN_ALPHA_140_000	Kabuto is a Pokémon that has been regenerated from a fossil.\nHowever, in extremely rare cases, living examples have\nbeen discovered. The Pokémon has not changed at all for\n300 million years.
ZKN_ALPHA_141_000	Kabutops swam underwater to hunt for its prey in ancient\ntimes. The Pokémon was apparently evolving from being a\nwater dweller to living on land as evident from the beginnings\nof change in its gills and legs.
ZKN_ALPHA_142_000	Aerodactyl is a Pokémon from the age of dinosaurs. It was\nregenerated from genetic material extracted from amber. It is\nimagined to have been the king of the skies in ancient times.
ZKN_ALPHA_143_000	Snorlax’s typical day consists of nothing more than eating and\nsleeping. It is such a docile Pokémon that there are children\nwho use its expansive belly as a place to play.
ZKN_ALPHA_144_000	Articuno is a legendary bird Pokémon that can control ice.\nThe flapping of its wings chills the air. As a result, it is said\nthat when this Pokémon flies, snow will fall.
ZKN_ALPHA_145_000	Zapdos is a legendary bird Pokémon that has the ability\nto control electricity. It usually lives in thunderclouds.\nThe Pokémon gains power if it is stricken by lightning bolts.
ZKN_ALPHA_146_000	Moltres is a legendary bird Pokémon that has the ability\nto control fire. If this Pokémon is injured, it is said to dip its\nbody in the molten magma of a volcano to burn and heal itself.
ZKN_ALPHA_147_000	Dratini continually molts and sloughs off its old skin. It does so\nbecause the life energy within its body steadily builds to reach\nuncontrollable levels.
ZKN_ALPHA_148_000	Dragonair stores an enormous amount of energy inside\nits body. It is said to alter weather conditions in its vicinity\nby discharging energy from the crystals on its neck and tail.
ZKN_ALPHA_149_000	Dragonite is capable of circling the globe in just 16 hours.\nIt is a kindhearted Pokémon that leads lost and foundering\nships in a storm to the safety of land.
ZKN_ALPHA_150_000	Mewtwo is a Pokémon that was created by genetic\nmanipulation. However, even though the scientific power\nof humans created this Pokémon’s body, they failed to\nendow Mewtwo with a compassionate heart.
ZKN_ALPHA_151_000	Mew is said to possess the genetic composition of all\nPokémon. It is capable of making itself invisible at will,\nso it entirely avoids notice even if it approaches people.
ZKN_ALPHA_152_000	In battle, Chikorita waves its leaf around to keep the foe at\nbay. However, a sweet fragrance also wafts from the leaf,\nbecalming the battling Pokémon and creating a cozy,\nfriendly atmosphere all around.
ZKN_ALPHA_153_000	Bayleef’s neck is ringed by curled-up leaves. Inside each\ntubular leaf is a small shoot of a tree. The fragrance of this\nshoot makes people peppy.
ZKN_ALPHA_154_000	The fragrance of Meganium’s flower soothes and calms\nemotions. In battle, this Pokémon gives off more of its\nbecalming scent to blunt the foe’s fighting spirit.
ZKN_ALPHA_155_000	Cyndaquil protects itself by flaring up the flames on its back.\nThe flames are vigorous if the Pokémon is angry. However, if it\nis tired, the flames splutter fitfully with incomplete combustion.
ZKN_ALPHA_156_000	Quilava keeps its foes at bay with the intensity of its flames\nand gusts of superheated air. This Pokémon applies its\noutstanding nimbleness to dodge attacks even while scorching\nthe foe with flames.
ZKN_ALPHA_157_000	Typhlosion obscures itself behind a shimmering heat haze that\nit creates using its intensely hot flames. This Pokémon creates\nblazing explosive blasts that burn everything to cinders.
ZKN_ALPHA_158_000	Despite the smallness of its body, Totodile’s jaws are very\npowerful. While the Pokémon may think it is just playfully\nnipping, its bite has enough power to cause serious injury.
ZKN_ALPHA_159_000	Once Croconaw has clamped its jaws on its foe, it will\nabsolutely not let go. Because the tips of its fangs are\nforked back like barbed fishhooks, they become impossible\nto remove when they have sunk in.
ZKN_ALPHA_160_000	Feraligatr intimidates its foes by opening its huge mouth.\nIn battle, it will kick the ground hard with its thick and powerful\nhind legs to charge at the foe at an incredible speed.
ZKN_ALPHA_161_000	When Sentret sleeps, it does so while another stands guard.\nThe sentry wakes the others at the first sign of danger. When\nthis Pokémon becomes separated from its pack, it becomes\nincapable of sleep due to fear.
ZKN_ALPHA_162_000	Furret has a very slim build. When under attack, it can slickly\nsquirm through narrow spaces and get away. In spite of its\nshort limbs, this Pokémon is very nimble and fleet.
ZKN_ALPHA_163_000	Hoothoot has an internal organ that senses and tracks the\nearth’s rotation. Using this special organ, this Pokémon\nbegins hooting at precisely the same time every day.
ZKN_ALPHA_164_000	Noctowl never fails at catching prey in darkness. This Pokémon\nowes its success to its superior vision that allows it to see in\nminimal light, and to its soft, supple wings that make no sound\nin flight.
ZKN_ALPHA_165_000	Ledyba secretes an aromatic fluid from where its legs join its\nbody. This fluid is used for communicating with others.\nThis Pokémon conveys its feelings to others by altering the\nfluid’s scent.
ZKN_ALPHA_166_000	It is said that in lands with clean air, where the stars fill the\nsky, there live Ledian in countless numbers. There is a good\nreason for this—the Pokémon uses the light of the stars as\nits energy.
ZKN_ALPHA_167_000	The web spun by Spinarak can be considered its second\nnervous system. It is said that this Pokémon can determine\nwhat kind of prey is touching its web just by the tiny vibrations\nit feels through the web’s strands.
ZKN_ALPHA_168_000	Ariados’s feet are tipped with tiny hooked claws that enable it\nto scuttle on ceilings and vertical walls. This Pokémon\nconstricts the foe with thin and strong silk webbing.
ZKN_ALPHA_169_000	Crobat sneaks up on its intended prey using wings that barely\nmake a sound. This Pokémon rests by hanging on a tree\nbranch with its rear legs that serve as wings.
ZKN_ALPHA_170_000	Chinchou’s two antennas are filled with cells that generate\nstrong electricity. This Pokémon’s cells create so much\nelectrical power, it even makes itself tingle slightly.
ZKN_ALPHA_171_000	Lanturn is known to emit light. If you peer down into the dark\nsea from a ship at night, you can sometimes see this\nPokémon’s light rising from the depths where it swims. It gives\nthe sea an appearance of a starlit night.
ZKN_ALPHA_172_000	When Pichu plays with others, it may short out electricity with\nanother Pichu, creating a shower of sparks. In that event, this\nPokémon will begin crying, startled by the flash of sparks.
ZKN_ALPHA_173_000	On nights with many shooting stars, Cleffa can be seen\ndancing in a ring. They dance through the night and stop only\nat the break of day, when these Pokémon quench their thirst\nwith the morning dew.
ZKN_ALPHA_174_000	Igglybuff has a soft and plushy body that feels very much like\na marshmallow. From this body wafts a gently sweet fragrance\nthat soothes and calms the emotions of its foes.
ZKN_ALPHA_175_000	As its energy, Togepi uses the positive emotions of\ncompassion and pleasure exuded by people and Pokémon.\nThis Pokémon stores up feelings of happiness inside its shell,\nthen shares them with others.
ZKN_ALPHA_176_000	Togetic is said to be a Pokémon that brings good fortune.\nWhen the Pokémon spots someone who is pure of heart,\nit is said to appear and share its happiness with that person.
ZKN_ALPHA_177_000	Natu has a highly developed jumping ability. The Pokémon\nflaps and leaps onto tree branches that are taller than\ngrown-up people to pick at the tree’s new shoots.
ZKN_ALPHA_178_000	Xatu is known to stand motionless while staring at the sun all\nday long. Some people revere it as a mystical Pokémon out of\ntheir belief that Xatu is in possession of the power to see into\nthe future.
ZKN_ALPHA_179_000	Mareep’s fluffy coat of wool rubs together and builds a static\ncharge. The more static electricity is charged, the more brightly\nthe lightbulb at the tip of its tail glows.
ZKN_ALPHA_180_000	Flaaffy’s wool quality changes so that it can generate\na high amount of static electricity with a small amount of\nwool. The bare and slick parts of its hide are shielded\nagainst electricity.
ZKN_ALPHA_181_000	Ampharos gives off so much light that it can be seen even from\nspace. People in the old days used the light of this Pokémon\nto send signals back and forth with others far away.
ZKN_ALPHA_182_000	A Bellossom grows flowers more beautifully if it has evolved\nfrom a smelly Gloom—the more stinky the better. At night, this\nPokémon closes its petals and goes to sleep.
ZKN_ALPHA_183_000	When fishing for food at the edge of a fast-running stream,\nMarill wraps its tail around the trunk of a tree. This Pokémon’s\ntail is flexible and configured to stretch.
ZKN_ALPHA_184_000	Azumarill can make balloons out of air. It makes these air\nballoons if it spots a drowning Pokémon. The air balloons\nenable the Pokémon in trouble to breathe.
ZKN_ALPHA_185_000	Sudowoodo camouflages itself as a tree to avoid being\nattacked by enemies. However, because its hands remain\ngreen throughout the year, the Pokémon is easily identified\nas a fake during the winter.
ZKN_ALPHA_186_000	The curled hair on Politoed’s head is proof of its status as a\nking. It is said that the longer and more curled the hair, the\nmore respect this Pokémon earns from its peers.
ZKN_ALPHA_187_000	This Pokémon drifts and floats with the wind. If it senses the\napproach of strong winds, Hoppip links its leaves with other\nHoppip to prepare against being blown away.
ZKN_ALPHA_188_000	Skiploom’s flower blossoms when the temperature rises\nabove 64 degrees Fahrenheit. How much the flower opens\ndepends on the temperature. For that reason, this Pokémon\nis sometimes used as a thermometer.
ZKN_ALPHA_189_000	Jumpluff rides warm southern winds to cross the sea and fly to\nforeign lands. The Pokémon descends to the ground when it\nencounters cold air while it is floating.
ZKN_ALPHA_190_000	Aipom’s tail ends in a hand-like appendage that can be cleverly\nmanipulated. However, because the Pokémon uses its tail so\nmuch, its real hands have become rather clumsy.
ZKN_ALPHA_191_000	Sunkern tries to move as little as it possibly can. It does so\nbecause it tries to conserve all the nutrients it has stored in its\nbody for its evolution. It will not eat a thing, subsisting only on\nmorning dew.
ZKN_ALPHA_192_000	Sunflora converts solar energy into nutrition. It moves around\nactively in the daytime when it is warm. It stops moving as\nsoon as the sun goes down for the night.
ZKN_ALPHA_193_000	Yanma is capable of seeing 360 degrees without having to\nmove its eyes. It is a great flier that is adept at making sudden\nstops and turning midair. This Pokémon uses its flying ability\nto quickly chase down targeted prey.
ZKN_ALPHA_194_000	Wooper usually lives in water. However, it occasionally comes\nout onto land in search of food. On land, it coats its body with\na gooey, toxic film.
ZKN_ALPHA_195_000	Quagsire hunts for food by leaving its mouth wide open in\nwater and waiting for its prey to blunder in unaware. Because\nthe Pokémon does not move, it does not get very hungry.
ZKN_ALPHA_196_000	Espeon is extremely loyal to any Trainer it considers to\nbe worthy. It is said that this Pokémon developed its\nprecognitive powers to protect its Trainer from harm.
ZKN_ALPHA_197_000	Umbreon evolved as a result of exposure to the moon’s waves.\nIt hides silently in darkness and waits for its foes to make a\nmove. The rings on its body glow when it leaps to attack.
ZKN_ALPHA_198_000	Murkrow was feared and loathed as the alleged bearer of ill\nfortune. This Pokémon shows strong interest in anything that\nsparkles or glitters. It will even try to steal rings from women.
ZKN_ALPHA_199_000	Slowking undertakes research every day in an effort to solve\nthe mysteries of the world. However, this Pokémon apparently\nforgets everything it has learned if the Shellder on its head\ncomes off.
ZKN_ALPHA_200_000	Misdreavus frightens people with a creepy, sobbing cry.\nThe Pokémon apparently uses its red spheres to absorb the\nfearful feelings of foes and turn them into nutrition.
ZKN_ALPHA_201_000	This Pokémon is shaped like ancient writing. It is a mystery as\nto which came first, the ancient writings or the various Unown.\nResearch into this topic is ongoing but nothing is known.
ZKN_ALPHA_202_000	Wobbuffet does nothing but endure attacks—it won’t attack on\nits own. However, it won’t endure an attack on its tail. When\nthat happens, the Pokémon will try to take the foe with it using\nDestiny Bond.
ZKN_ALPHA_203_000	Girafarig’s rear head contains a tiny brain that is too small for\nthinking. However, the rear head doesn’t need to sleep, so it\ncan keep watch over its surroundings 24 hours a day.
ZKN_ALPHA_204_000	Pineco hangs from a tree branch and patiently waits for prey to\ncome along. If the Pokémon is disturbed while eating by\nsomeone shaking its tree, it drops down to the ground and\nexplodes with no warning.
ZKN_ALPHA_205_000	Forretress conceals itself inside its hardened steel shell.\nThe shell is opened when the Pokémon is catching prey,\nbut it does so at such a quick pace that the shell’s inside\ncannot be seen.
ZKN_ALPHA_206_000	Dunsparce has a drill for its tail. It uses this tail to burrow into\nthe ground backward. This Pokémon is known to make its\nnest in complex shapes deep under the ground.
ZKN_ALPHA_207_000	Gligar glides through the air without a sound as if it were\nsliding. This Pokémon hangs on to the face of its foe using\nits clawed hind legs and the large pincers on its forelegs, then\ninjects the prey with its poison barb.
ZKN_ALPHA_208_000	Steelix lives even further underground than Onix.\nThis Pokémon is known to dig toward the earth’s core.\nThere are records of this Pokémon reaching a depth of\nover six-tenths of a mile underground.
ZKN_ALPHA_209_000	By baring its fangs and making a scary face, Snubbull sends\nsmaller Pokémon scurrying away in terror. However, this\nPokémon seems a little sad at making its foes flee.
ZKN_ALPHA_210_000	Granbull has a particularly well-developed lower jaw.\nThe enormous fangs are heavy, causing the Pokémon to tip\nits head back for balance. Unless it is startled, it will not try to\nbite indiscriminately.
ZKN_ALPHA_211_000	Qwilfish sucks in water, inflating itself. This Pokémon\nuses the pressure of the water it swallowed to shoot toxic\nquills all at once from all over its body. It finds swimming\nsomewhat challenging.
ZKN_ALPHA_212_000	Scizor has a body with the hardness of steel. It is not easily\nfazed by ordinary sorts of attacks. This Pokémon flaps its\nwings to regulate its body temperature.
ZKN_ALPHA_213_000	Shuckle quietly hides itself under rocks, keeping its body\nconcealed inside its hard shell while eating berries it has\nstored away. The berries mix with its body fluids to become\na juice.
ZKN_ALPHA_214_000	Heracross has sharp claws on its feet. These are planted\nfirmly into the ground or the bark of a tree, giving the\nPokémon a secure and solid footing to forcefully fling away\nfoes with its proud horn.
ZKN_ALPHA_215_000	Sneasel scales trees by punching its hooked claws into the\nbark. This Pokémon seeks out unguarded nests and steals\neggs for food while the parents are away.
ZKN_ALPHA_216_000	This Pokémon likes to lick its palms that are sweetened by\nbeing soaked in honey. Teddiursa concocts its own honey\nby blending fruits and pollen collected by Beedrill.
ZKN_ALPHA_217_000	In the forests inhabited by Ursaring, it is said that there are\nmany streams and towering trees where they gather food. This\nPokémon walks through its forest gathering food every day.
ZKN_ALPHA_218_000	Slugma does not have any blood in its body. Instead, intensely\nhot magma circulates throughout this Pokémon’s body,\ncarrying essential nutrients and oxygen to its organs.
ZKN_ALPHA_219_000	Magcargo’s body temperature is approximately\n18,000 degrees Fahrenheit. Water is vaporized on contact.\nIf this Pokémon is caught in the rain, the raindrops instantly\nturn into steam, cloaking the area in a thick fog.
ZKN_ALPHA_220_000	Swinub roots for food by rubbing its snout against the ground.\nIts favorite food is a mushroom that grows under the cover of\ndead grass. This Pokémon occasionally roots out hot springs.
ZKN_ALPHA_221_000	Piloswine is covered by a thick coat of long hair that enables\nit to endure the freezing cold. This Pokémon uses its tusks to\ndig up food that has been buried under ice.
ZKN_ALPHA_222_000	Clusters of Corsola congregate in warm seas where they serve\nas ideal hiding places for smaller Pokémon. When the water\ntemperature falls, this Pokémon migrates to the southern seas.
ZKN_ALPHA_223_000	Remoraid sucks in water, then expels it at high velocity using\nits abdominal muscles to shoot down flying prey. When\nevolution draws near, this Pokémon travels downstream\nfrom rivers.

ZKN_ALPHA_225_000	Delibird carries its food bundled up in its tail. There once was\na famous explorer who managed to reach the peak of the\nworld’s highest mountain, thanks to one of these Pokémon\nsharing its food.
ZKN_ALPHA_226_000	On sunny days, schools of Mantine can be seen elegantly\nleaping over the sea’s waves. This Pokémon is not bothered\nby the Remoraid that hitches rides.
ZKN_ALPHA_227_000	Skarmory’s steel wings become tattered and bashed in from\nrepeated battles. Once a year, the battered wings grow back\ncompletely, restoring the cutting edges to their pristine state.
ZKN_ALPHA_228_000	Houndour hunt as a coordinated pack. They communicate\nwith each other using a variety of cries to corner their prey.\nThis Pokémon’s remarkable teamwork is unparalleled.

ZKN_ALPHA_230_000	Kingdra sleeps on the seafloor where it is otherwise devoid\nof life. When a storm arrives, the Pokémon is said to awaken\nand wander about in search of prey.
ZKN_ALPHA_231_000	Phanpy uses its long nose to shower itself. When others\ngather around, they thoroughly douse each other with water.\nThese Pokémon can be seen drying their soaking-wet\nbodies at the edge of water.
ZKN_ALPHA_232_000	If Donphan were to tackle with its hard body, even a house\ncould be destroyed. Using its massive strength, the Pokémon\nhelps clear rock and mud slides that block mountain trails.

ZKN_ALPHA_235_000	Smeargle marks the boundaries of its territory using a body\nfluid that leaks out from the tip of its tail. Over 5,000 different\nmarks left by this Pokémon have been found.
ZKN_ALPHA_236_000	Tyrogue becomes stressed out if it does not get to train every\nday. When raising this Pokémon, the Trainer must establish\nand uphold various training methods.
ZKN_ALPHA_237_000	Hitmontop spins on its head at high speed, all the while\ndelivering kicks. This technique is a remarkable mix of both\noffense and defense at the same time. The Pokémon travels\nfaster spinning than it does walking.

ZKN_ALPHA_239_000	Elekid stores electricity in its body. If it touches metal and\naccidentally discharges all its built-up electricity, this Pokémon\nbegins swinging its arms in circles to recharge itself.
ZKN_ALPHA_240_000	Magby’s state of health is determined by observing the fire it\nbreathes. If the Pokémon is spouting yellow flames from its\nmouth, it is in good health. When it is fatigued, black smoke\nwill be mixed in with the flames.

ZKN_ALPHA_309_000	Electrike runs faster than the human eye can follow.\nThe friction from running is converted into electricity,\nwhich is then stored in this Pokémon’s fur.
ZKN_ALPHA_310_000	Manectric discharges strong electricity from its mane.\nThe mane is used for collecting electricity in the atmosphere.\nThis Pokémon creates thunderclouds above its head.
ZKN_ALPHA_311_000	When Plusle is cheering on its partner, it flashes with electric\nsparks from all over its body. If its partner loses, this Pokémon\ncries loudly.
ZKN_ALPHA_312_000	Minun loves to cheer on its partner in battle. It gives off sparks\nfrom its body while it is doing so. If its partner is in trouble,\nthis Pokémon gives off increasing amounts of sparks.

ZKN_DIAMOND_001_000	For some time after its birth, it grows by taking\nnourishment from the seed on its back.
ZKN_DIAMOND_002_000	When the bud on its back starts swelling,\na sweet aroma wafts to indicate the flower’s\ncoming bloom.
ZKN_DIAMOND_003_000	After a rainy day, the flower on its back smells\nstronger. The scent attracts other Pokémon.
ZKN_DIAMOND_004_000	The fire on the tip of its tail is a measure of\nits life. If the Pokémon is healthy, its tail\nburns intensely.
ZKN_DIAMOND_005_000	In the rocky mountains where Charmeleon live,\ntheir fiery tails shine at night like stars.
ZKN_DIAMOND_006_000	It is said that Charizard’s fire burns hotter if\nit has experienced harsh battles.
ZKN_DIAMOND_007_000	It hides in its shell to protect itself, then strikes\nback with spouts of water at every opportunity.
ZKN_DIAMOND_008_000	It is said to live 10,000 years. Its furry tail is\npopular as a symbol of longevity.
ZKN_DIAMOND_009_000	The jets of water it spouts from the rocket\ncannons on its shell can punch through thick steel.
ZKN_DIAMOND_010_000	It releases a stench from its red antennae to repel\nenemies. It grows by molting repeatedly.
ZKN_DIAMOND_011_000	A steel-hard shell protects its tender body.\nThe Pokémon quietly endures hardships while\nawaiting evolution.
ZKN_DIAMOND_012_000	It loves the nectar of flowers and can locate\nflower patches that have even tiny amounts\nof pollen.
ZKN_DIAMOND_013_000	It eats its weight in leaves every day. It fends off\nattackers with the needle on its head.
ZKN_DIAMOND_014_000	While awaiting evolution, it hides from predators\nunder leaves and in nooks of branches.
ZKN_DIAMOND_015_000	Its best attack involves flying around at high\nspeed, striking with poison needles, then\nflying off.
ZKN_DIAMOND_016_000	It is docile and prefers to avoid conflict.\nIf disturbed, however, it can ferociously\nstrike back.
ZKN_DIAMOND_017_000	It flies over its wide territory in search of prey,\ndowning it with its highly developed claws.
ZKN_DIAMOND_018_000	By flapping its wings with all its might, Pidgeot\ncan make a gust of wind capable of bending\ntall trees.
ZKN_DIAMOND_019_000	It’s cautious in the extreme, and its hardy vitality\nlets it live in any kind of environment.
ZKN_DIAMOND_020_000	It whittles down its constantly growing fangs\nby gnawing on hard things. It can chew apart\ncinder block walls.
ZKN_DIAMOND_021_000	It flaps its small wings busily to fly. Using its beak,\nit searches in grass for prey.
ZKN_DIAMOND_022_000	It has the stamina to fly all day on its broad\nwings. It fights by using its sharp beak.
ZKN_DIAMOND_023_000	It sneaks through grass without making a sound\nand strikes unsuspecting prey from behind.
ZKN_DIAMOND_024_000	The pattern on its belly is for intimidation.\nIt constricts foes while they are frozen in fear.
ZKN_DIAMOND_025_000	It lives in forests with others. It stores electricity\nin the electric sacs on its cheeks.
ZKN_DIAMOND_026_000	It turns aggressive if it has too much electricity in\nits body. It discharges power through its tail.
ZKN_DIAMOND_027_000	To protect itself from attackers, it curls up into a\nball. It lives in arid regions with minimal rainfall.
ZKN_DIAMOND_028_000	It curls up, then rolls into foes with its back.\nIts sharp spines inflict severe damage.
ZKN_DIAMOND_029_000	While this Pokémon does not prefer to fight,\neven one drop of the venom it secretes from its\nbarbs can be fatal.
ZKN_DIAMOND_030_000	When it senses danger, it raises all the barbs\non its body. These barbs grow more slowly\nthan Nidorino’s.
ZKN_DIAMOND_031_000	Its entire body is armored with hard scales. It will\nprotect the young in its burrow with its life.
ZKN_DIAMOND_032_000	It scans its surroundings by raising its ears out of\nthe grass. Its toxic horn is for protection.
ZKN_DIAMOND_033_000	It has a violent disposition and stabs foes with\nits horn, which oozes venom upon impact.
ZKN_DIAMOND_034_000	One swing of its mighty tail can snap a telephone\npole as if it were a matchstick.
ZKN_DIAMOND_035_000	Thought to live with others on quiet mountains,\nit is popular for its adorable nature.
ZKN_DIAMOND_036_000	Rarely seen by people, it is said to be drawn by\nthe full moon to play at deserted lakes.
ZKN_DIAMOND_037_000	It controls balls of fire. As it grows, its six tails\nsplit from their tips to make more tails.
ZKN_DIAMOND_038_000	Its nine tails are said to be imbued with a\nmystic power. The Pokémon is said to live\nfor 1,000 years.
ZKN_DIAMOND_039_000	When it wavers its big, round eyes, it begins\nsinging a lullaby that makes everyone drowsy.

ZKN_LETSGO_125_000	If a major power outage occurs, it is certain\nthat this Pokémon has eaten electricity\nat a power plant.
ZKN_LETSGO_126_000	Born in an active volcano. Its body is\nalways cloaked in flames, so it looks like\na big ball of fire.
ZKN_LETSGO_127_000	Grips its prey in its pincers and squeezes hard!\nIt can’t move if it’s cold out, so it lives in\nwarm places.
ZKN_LETSGO_128_000	A rowdy Pokémon with a lot of stamina.\nOnce running, it won’t stop until it\nhits something.
ZKN_LETSGO_129_000	Famous for being very unreliable. It can be\nfound swimming in seas, lakes, rivers,\nand shallow puddles.
ZKN_LETSGO_130_000	Brutally vicious and enormously destructive.\nKnown for totally destroying cities in\nancient times.
ZKN_LETSGO_131_000	A gentle soul that can understand\nhuman speech. It can ferry people across\nthe sea on its back.
ZKN_LETSGO_132_000	When it spots an enemy, its body transfigures\ninto an almost-perfect copy of its opponent.
ZKN_LETSGO_133_000	It can evolve into a variety of forms.\nEevee’s genes are the key to solving\nthe mysteries of Pokémon evolution.
ZKN_LETSGO_134_000	Its cell structure is similar to water molecules.\nIt melts into the water and becomes invisible.
ZKN_LETSGO_135_000	A sensitive Pokémon that easily becomes sad\nor angry. Every time its mood changes, it\ncharges power.
ZKN_LETSGO_136_000	It has a flame chamber inside its body. It inhales,\nthen breathes out fire that is over 3,000\ndegrees Fahrenheit.
ZKN_LETSGO_137_000	The only Pokémon that people anticipate\ncan fly into space. None has managed\nthe feat yet, however.
ZKN_LETSGO_138_000	An ancient Pokémon that was recovered from\na fossil. It swam by cleverly twisting its\n10 tentacles about.
ZKN_LETSGO_139_000	Its sharp beak rings its mouth. Its shell was too\nbig for it to move freely, so it became extinct.
ZKN_LETSGO_140_000	A Pokémon that was recovered from a fossil.\nIt used the eyes on its back while hiding\non the seafloor.
ZKN_LETSGO_141_000	A slim and fast swimmer. It sliced its prey with\nits sharp sickles and drank the body fluids.
ZKN_LETSGO_142_000	A savage Pokémon that died out in ancient\ntimes. It was resurrected using DNA taken\nfrom amber.
ZKN_LETSGO_143_000	Will eat anything, even if the food happens to\nbe a little moldy. It never gets an upset stomach.
ZKN_LETSGO_144_000	A legendary bird Pokémon. It freezes water\nthat is contained in winter air and makes it snow.
ZKN_LETSGO_145_000	This legendary bird Pokémon is said to\nappear when the sky turns dark and lightning\nshowers down.
ZKN_LETSGO_146_000	A legendary bird Pokémon. As it flaps its\nflaming wings, even the night sky will turn red.
ZKN_LETSGO_147_000	Long thought to be a myth, this Pokémon’s\nexistence was only recently confirmed by a\nfisherman who caught one.
ZKN_LETSGO_148_000	According to a witness, its body was surrounded\nby a strange aura that gave it a mystical look.
ZKN_LETSGO_149_000	It is said that this Pokémon lives somewhere\nin the sea and that it flies. However, these are\nonly rumors.
ZKN_LETSGO_150_000	Its DNA is almost the same as Mew’s. However,\nits size and disposition are vastly different.
ZKN_LETSGO_151_000	When viewed through a microscope, this\nPokémon’s short, fine, delicate hair can be seen.

ZKN_LETSGO_009_001	The cannon on its back is as powerful as a\ntank gun. Its tough legs and back enable it to\nwithstand the recoil from firing the cannon.

ZKN_MOON_008_000	
ZKN_MOON_009_000	
ZKN_MOON_010_000	It’s easy to catch, and it grows quickly, making\nit one of the top recommendations for novice\nPokémon Trainers.
ZKN_MOON_011_000	Its shell is hard, but it’s still just a bug shell.\nIt’s been known to break, so intense battles\nwith it should be avoided.
ZKN_MOON_012_000	When attacked by other Pokémon, it defends\nitself by scattering its poisonous scales and\nfluttering its wings.
ZKN_MOON_013_000	
ZKN_MOON_014_000	
ZKN_MOON_015_000	
ZKN_MOON_016_000	
ZKN_MOON_017_000	
ZKN_MOON_018_000	
ZKN_MOON_019_000	With their strong capacity for survival, they can\nlive in dirty places without concern. Left\nunchecked, their numbers multiply rapidly.
ZKN_MOON_020_000	Its disposition is far more violent than its looks\nwould suggest. Don’t let your hand get too close\nto its face, as it could bite your hand clean off.
ZKN_MOON_021_000	Farmers whose fields are troubled by bug\nPokémon appreciate Spearow for its vigorous\nappetite and look after it.
ZKN_MOON_022_000	Drawings of a Pokémon resembling Fearow can\nbe seen in murals from deep in ancient history.
ZKN_MOON_023_000	
ZKN_MOON_024_000	
ZKN_MOON_025_000	It’s in its nature to store electricity. It feels\nstressed now and then if it’s unable to fully\ndischarge the electricity.
ZKN_MOON_026_000	It becomes aggressive when it has electricity\nstored up. At such times, even its Trainer has to\ntake care to avoid being attacked.
ZKN_MOON_027_000	It usually makes its home in deserts and arid\nzones, where rain does not fall. It digs holes to\ncatch Bug-type Pokémon.
ZKN_MOON_028_000	It uses its claws to climb trees and then curls\nits body into a spiny ball, ready to drop onto\nany prey that appears.
ZKN_MOON_029_000	
ZKN_MOON_030_000	
ZKN_MOON_031_000	
ZKN_MOON_032_000	
ZKN_MOON_033_000	
ZKN_MOON_034_000	
ZKN_MOON_035_000	On nights with a full moon, they gather together\nand dance. The surrounding area is enveloped\nin an abnormal magnetic field.
ZKN_MOON_036_000	According to tradition, people who see a pair\nof Clefable skipping by can look forward to a\nhappy marriage.
ZKN_MOON_037_000	From its mouth spew flames that seem to\nresemble the spirits of the deceased. Some\npeople mistakenly think this fire is a ghost.
ZKN_MOON_038_000	Said to live for a thousand years, this Pokémon\nuses its supernatural abilities to manipulate fire.\nIt can burn its prey to a crisp as it pleases.
ZKN_MOON_039_000	Jigglypuff possess a vocal range that exceeds\n12 octaves, but each individual’s singing skill\ndepends on its own effort.
ZKN_MOON_040_000	As it inhales, it expands...and expands...and\nexpands. Wigglytuff compete to see which one\ncan inflate itself the most.
ZKN_MOON_041_000	When exposed to sunlight, they suffer burns.\nThe frequency of their ultrasonic waves can\ndiffer slightly from colony to colony.
ZKN_MOON_042_000	Sometimes they drink so much blood, they can’t\nfly anymore. Then they fall to the ground and\nbecome food for other Pokémon.
ZKN_MOON_043_000	
ZKN_MOON_044_000	
ZKN_MOON_045_000	
ZKN_MOON_046_000	Mushrooms called tochukaso sprout from its\nback. They can be dried and powdered to make\na medicine used to extend life.
ZKN_MOON_047_000	It scatters toxic spores from its mushroom cap.\nOnce harvested, these spores can be steeped\nand boiled down to prepare herbal medicines.
ZKN_MOON_048_000	
ZKN_MOON_049_000	
ZKN_MOON_050_000	Many farmers cherish and nurture Diglett\nbecause its droppings enrich the soil it lives in.
ZKN_MOON_051_000	Despite the closeness between this Pokémon\nand farmers and other people, no one has ever\nseen the parts of it concealed underground.
ZKN_MOON_052_000	It loves shiny things. It often fights with\nMurkrow over prey they’re both trying to catch.
ZKN_MOON_053_000	It has a high opinion of itself, although not to\nthe same extent as the Alolan Persian. It’s quite\ndifficult to make friends with this Pokémon.

ZKN_OMEGA_000_000	
ZKN_OMEGA_001_000	Bulbasaur can be seen napping in bright sunlight.\nThere is a seed on its back. By soaking up the sun’s rays,\nthe seed grows progressively larger.
ZKN_OMEGA_002_000	There is a bud on this Pokémon’s back. To support its weight,\nIvysaur’s legs and trunk grow thick and strong.\nIf it starts spending more time lying in the sunlight,\nit’s a sign that the bud will bloom into a large flower soon.
ZKN_OMEGA_003_000	There is a large flower on Venusaur’s back. The flower is said\nto take on vivid colors if it gets plenty of nutrition and sunlight.\nThe flower’s aroma soothes the emotions of people.
ZKN_OMEGA_004_000	The flame that burns at the tip of its tail is an indication\nof its emotions. The flame wavers when Charmander\nis enjoying itself. If the Pokémon becomes enraged,\nthe flame burns fiercely.
ZKN_OMEGA_005_000	Charmeleon mercilessly destroys its foes using its sharp claws.\nIf it encounters a strong foe, it turns aggressive.\nIn this excited state, the flame at the tip of its tail flares with a\nbluish white color.
ZKN_OMEGA_006_000	Charizard flies around the sky in search of powerful opponents.\nIt breathes fire of such great heat that it melts anything.\nHowever, it never turns its fiery breath on any opponent\nweaker than itself.
ZKN_OMEGA_007_000	Squirtle’s shell is not merely used for protection.\nThe shell’s rounded shape and the grooves on its surface\nhelp minimize resistance in water, enabling this Pokémon\nto swim at high speeds.
ZKN_OMEGA_008_000	Its tail is large and covered with a rich, thick fur. The tail\nbecomes increasingly deeper in color as Wartortle ages.\nThe scratches on its shell are evidence of this Pokémon’s\ntoughness as a battler.
ZKN_OMEGA_009_000	Blastoise has water spouts that protrude from its shell.\nThe water spouts are very accurate. They can shoot bullets of\nwater with enough accuracy to strike empty cans from a\ndistance of over 160 feet.
ZKN_OMEGA_010_000	Caterpie has a voracious appetite. It can devour leaves bigger\nthan its body right before your eyes. From its antenna, this\nPokémon releases a terrifically strong odor.
ZKN_OMEGA_011_000	The shell covering this Pokémon’s body is as hard as an\niron slab. Metapod does not move very much. It stays still\nbecause it is preparing its soft innards for evolution inside\nthe hard shell.
ZKN_OMEGA_012_000	Butterfree has a superior ability to search for delicious honey\nfrom flowers. It can even search out, extract, and carry honey\nfrom flowers that are blooming over six miles from its nest.
ZKN_OMEGA_013_000	Weedle has an extremely acute sense of smell. It is capable of\ndistinguishing its favorite kinds of leaves from those it dislikes\njust by sniffing with its big red proboscis (nose).
ZKN_OMEGA_014_000	Kakuna remains virtually immobile as it clings to a tree.\nHowever, on the inside, it is extremely busy as it prepares for\nits coming evolution. This is evident from how hot the shell\nbecomes to the touch.
ZKN_OMEGA_015_000	Beedrill is extremely territorial. No one should ever approach\nits nest—this is for their own safety. If angered, they will attack\nin a furious swarm.
ZKN_OMEGA_016_000	Pidgey has an extremely sharp sense of direction. It is capable\nof unerringly returning home to its nest, however far it may be\nremoved from its familiar surroundings.
ZKN_OMEGA_017_000	Pidgeotto claims a large area as its own territory.\nThis Pokémon flies around, patrolling its living space.\nIf its territory is violated, it shows no mercy in thoroughly\npunishing the foe with its sharp claws.
ZKN_OMEGA_018_000	This Pokémon has a dazzling plumage of beautifully\nglossy feathers. Many Trainers are captivated by the\nstriking beauty of the feathers on its head, compelling\nthem to choose Pidgeot as their Pokémon.
ZKN_OMEGA_019_000	Rattata is cautious in the extreme. Even while it is asleep,\nit constantly listens by moving its ears around. It is not picky\nabout where it lives—it will make its nest anywhere.
ZKN_OMEGA_020_000	Raticate’s sturdy fangs grow steadily. To keep them ground\ndown, it gnaws on rocks and logs. It may even chew on the\nwalls of houses.
ZKN_OMEGA_021_000	Spearow has a very loud cry that can be heard over\nhalf a mile away. If its high, keening cry is heard echoing all\naround, it is a sign that they are warning each other of danger.
ZKN_OMEGA_022_000	Fearow is recognized by its long neck and elongated beak.\nThey are conveniently shaped for catching prey in soil\nor water. It deftly moves its long and skinny beak to\npluck prey.
ZKN_OMEGA_023_000	Ekans curls itself up in a spiral while it rests. Assuming this\nposition allows it to quickly respond to a threat from any\ndirection with a glare from its upraised head.
ZKN_OMEGA_024_000	This Pokémon is terrifically strong in order to constrict things\nwith its body. It can even flatten steel oil drums.\nOnce Arbok wraps its body around its foe, escaping its\ncrunching embrace is impossible.
ZKN_OMEGA_025_000	Whenever Pikachu comes across something new,\nit blasts it with a jolt of electricity. If you come across a\nblackened berry, it’s evidence that this Pokémon mistook the\nintensity of its charge.
ZKN_OMEGA_026_000	If the electrical sacs become excessively charged,\nRaichu plants its tail in the ground and discharges.\nScorched patches of ground will be found near this\nPokémon’s nest.
ZKN_OMEGA_027_000	Sandshrew’s body is configured to absorb water without waste,\nenabling it to survive in an arid desert. This Pokémon curls up\nto protect itself from its enemies.
ZKN_OMEGA_028_000	Sandslash’s body is covered by tough spikes, which are\nhardened sections of its hide. Once a year, the old spikes\nfall out, to be replaced with new spikes that grow out from\nbeneath the old ones.
ZKN_OMEGA_029_000	Nidoran♀ has barbs that secrete a powerful poison.\nThey are thought to have developed as protection for\nthis small-bodied Pokémon. When enraged, it releases\na horrible toxin from its horn.
ZKN_OMEGA_030_000	When Nidorina are with their friends or family, they keep their\nbarbs tucked away to prevent hurting each other.\nThis Pokémon appears to become nervous if separated from\nthe others.
ZKN_OMEGA_031_000	Nidoqueen’s body is encased in extremely hard scales.\nIt is adept at sending foes flying with harsh tackles.\nThis Pokémon is at its strongest when it is defending its young.
ZKN_OMEGA_032_000	Nidoran♂ has developed muscles for moving its ears. Thanks\nto them, the ears can be freely moved in any direction. Even\nthe slightest sound does not escape this Pokémon’s notice.
ZKN_OMEGA_033_000	Nidorino has a horn that is harder than a diamond. If it senses\na hostile presence, all the barbs on its back bristle up at once,\nand it challenges the foe with all its might.
ZKN_OMEGA_034_000	Nidoking’s thick tail packs enormously destructive power.\nWith one swing, it can topple a metal transmission tower.\nOnce this Pokémon goes on a rampage, there is no stopping it.
ZKN_OMEGA_035_000	On every night of a full moon, groups of this Pokémon come\nout to play. When dawn arrives, the tired Clefairy return to their\nquiet mountain retreats and go to sleep nestled up against\neach other.
ZKN_OMEGA_036_000	Clefable moves by skipping lightly as if it were flying using its\nwings. Its bouncy step lets it even walk on water. It is known\nto take strolls on lakes on quiet, moonlit nights.
ZKN_OMEGA_037_000	At the time of its birth, Vulpix has one white tail. The tail\nseparates into six if this Pokémon receives plenty of love\nfrom its Trainer. The six tails become magnificently curled.
ZKN_OMEGA_038_000	Ninetales casts a sinister light from its bright red eyes to gain\ntotal control over its foe’s mind. This Pokémon is said to live\nfor a thousand years.
ZKN_OMEGA_039_000	Jigglypuff’s vocal cords can freely adjust the wavelength of its\nvoice. This Pokémon uses this ability to sing at precisely the\nright wavelength to make its foes most drowsy.
ZKN_OMEGA_040_000	Wigglytuff has large, saucerlike eyes. The surfaces of its eyes\nare always covered with a thin layer of tears. If any dust gets in\nthis Pokémon’s eyes, it is quickly washed away.
ZKN_OMEGA_041_000	Zubat remains quietly unmoving in a dark spot during the bright\ndaylight hours. It does so because prolonged exposure to the\nsun causes its body to become slightly burned.
ZKN_OMEGA_042_000	Golbat loves to drink the blood of living things. It is particularly\nactive in the pitch black of night. This Pokémon flits around in\nthe night skies, seeking fresh blood.
ZKN_OMEGA_043_000	During the daytime, Oddish buries itself in soil to absorb\nnutrients from the ground using its entire body.\nThe more fertile the soil, the glossier its leaves become.
ZKN_OMEGA_044_000	Gloom releases a foul fragrance from the pistil of its flower.\nWhen faced with danger, the stench worsens.\nIf this Pokémon is feeling calm and secure, it does not\nrelease its usual stinky aroma.
ZKN_OMEGA_045_000	Vileplume’s toxic pollen triggers atrocious allergy attacks.\nThat’s why it is advisable never to approach any attractive\nflowers in a jungle, however pretty they may be.
ZKN_OMEGA_046_000	Paras has parasitic mushrooms growing on its back called\ntochukaso. They grow large by drawing nutrients from this\nBug Pokémon host. They are highly valued as a medicine\nfor extending life.
ZKN_OMEGA_047_000	Parasect is known to infest large trees en masse and drain\nnutrients from the lower trunk and roots. When an infested tree\ndies, they move onto another tree all at once.
ZKN_OMEGA_048_000	Venonat is said to have evolved with a coat of thin,\nstiff hair that covers its entire body for protection.\nIt possesses large eyes that never fail to spot even\nminuscule prey.
ZKN_OMEGA_049_000	Venomoth is nocturnal—it is a Pokémon that only becomes\nactive at night. Its favorite prey are small insects that gather\naround streetlights, attracted by the light in the darkness.
ZKN_OMEGA_050_000	Diglett are raised in most farms. The reason is simple—\nwherever this Pokémon burrows, the soil is left perfectly tilled\nfor planting crops. This soil is made ideal for growing\ndelicious vegetables.
ZKN_OMEGA_051_000	Dugtrio are actually triplets that emerged from one body.\nAs a result, each triplet thinks exactly like the other\ntwo triplets. They work cooperatively to burrow endlessly.
ZKN_OMEGA_052_000	Meowth withdraws its sharp claws into its paws to slinkily sneak\nabout without making any incriminating footsteps.\nFor some reason, this Pokémon loves shiny coins that\nglitter with light.
ZKN_OMEGA_053_000	Persian has six bold whiskers that give it a look of toughness.\nThe whiskers sense air movements to determine what is in the\nPokémon’s surrounding vicinity. It becomes docile if grabbed\nby the whiskers.
ZKN_OMEGA_054_000	Psyduck uses a mysterious power. When it does so, this\nPokémon generates brain waves that are supposedly only seen\nin sleepers. This discovery spurred controversy\namong scholars.
ZKN_OMEGA_055_000	The webbed flippers on its forelegs and hind legs and the\nstreamlined body of Golduck give it frightening speed.\nThis Pokémon is definitely much faster than even the most\nathletic swimmer.
ZKN_OMEGA_056_000	When Mankey starts shaking and its nasal breathing turns\nrough, it’s a sure sign that it is becoming angry. However,\nbecause it goes into a towering rage almost instantly,\nit is impossible for anyone to flee its wrath.
ZKN_OMEGA_057_000	When Primeape becomes furious, its blood circulation is\nboosted. In turn, its muscles are made even stronger.\nHowever, it also becomes much less intelligent at the\nsame time.
ZKN_OMEGA_058_000	Growlithe has a superb sense of smell. Once it smells anything,\nthis Pokémon won’t forget the scent, no matter what. It uses\nits advanced olfactory sense to determine the emotions of\nother living things.
ZKN_OMEGA_059_000	Arcanine is known for its high speed. It is said to be capable of\nrunning over 6,200 miles in a single day and night.\nThe fire that blazes wildly within this Pokémon’s body is its\nsource of power.
ZKN_OMEGA_060_000	Poliwag has a very thin skin. It is possible to see the\nPokémon’s spiral innards right through the skin.\nDespite its thinness, however, the skin is also very flexible.\nEven sharp fangs bounce right off it.
ZKN_OMEGA_061_000	The surface of Poliwhirl’s body is always wet and slick with\na slimy fluid. Because of this slippery covering, it can easily\nslip and slide out of the clutches of any enemy in battle.
ZKN_OMEGA_062_000	Poliwrath’s highly developed, brawny muscles never grow\nfatigued, however much it exercises. It is so tirelessly strong,\nthis Pokémon can swim back and forth across the ocean\nwithout effort.
ZKN_OMEGA_063_000	Abra sleeps for eighteen hours a day. However, it can sense\nthe presence of foes even while it is sleeping. In such a\nsituation, this Pokémon immediately teleports to safety.
ZKN_OMEGA_064_000	Kadabra emits a peculiar alpha wave if it develops a headache.\nOnly those people with a particularly strong psyche can hope\nto become a Trainer of this Pokémon.
ZKN_OMEGA_065_000	Alakazam’s brain continually grows, making its head far too\nheavy to support with its neck. This Pokémon holds its head up\nusing its psychokinetic power instead.
ZKN_OMEGA_066_000	Machop’s muscles are special—they never get sore no matter\nhow much they are used in exercise. This Pokémon has\nsufficient power to hurl a hundred adult humans.
ZKN_OMEGA_067_000	Machoke’s thoroughly toned muscles possess the hardness\nof steel. This Pokémon has so much strength, it can easily\nhold aloft a sumo wrestler on just one finger.
ZKN_OMEGA_068_000	Machamp has the power to hurl anything aside. However,\ntrying to do any work requiring care and dexterity causes its\narms to get tangled. This Pokémon tends to leap into action\nbefore it thinks.
ZKN_OMEGA_069_000	Bellsprout’s thin and flexible body lets it bend and sway to\navoid any attack, however strong it may be. From its mouth,\nthis Pokémon spits a corrosive fluid that melts even iron.
ZKN_OMEGA_070_000	Weepinbell has a large hook on its rear end. At night, the\nPokémon hooks on to a tree branch and goes to sleep.\nIf it moves around in its sleep, it may wake up to find itself\non the ground.
ZKN_OMEGA_071_000	Victreebel has a long vine that extends from its head.\nThis vine is waved and flicked about as if it were an animal to\nattract prey. When an unsuspecting prey draws near, this\nPokémon swallows it whole.
ZKN_OMEGA_072_000	Tentacool’s body is largely composed of water. If it is removed\nfrom the sea, it dries up like parchment. If this Pokémon\nhappens to become dehydrated, put it back into the sea.
ZKN_OMEGA_073_000	Tentacruel has large red orbs on its head. The orbs glow\nbefore lashing the vicinity with a harsh ultrasonic blast.\nThis Pokémon’s outburst creates rough waves around it.
ZKN_OMEGA_074_000	The longer a Geodude lives, the more its edges are chipped\nand worn away, making it more rounded in appearance.\nHowever, this Pokémon’s heart will remain hard, craggy,\nand rough always.
ZKN_OMEGA_075_000	Graveler grows by feeding on rocks. Apparently, it prefers to\neat rocks that are covered in moss. This Pokémon eats its way\nthrough a ton of rocks on a daily basis.
ZKN_OMEGA_076_000	Golem live up on mountains. If there is a large earthquake,\nthese Pokémon will come rolling down off the mountains\nen masse to the foothills below.
ZKN_OMEGA_077_000	Ponyta is very weak at birth. It can barely stand up.\nThis Pokémon becomes stronger by stumbling and falling to\nkeep up with its parent.
ZKN_OMEGA_078_000	Rapidash usually can be seen casually cantering in the\nfields and plains. However, when this Pokémon turns serious,\nits fiery manes flare and blaze as it gallops its way up to\n150 mph.
ZKN_OMEGA_079_000	Slowpoke uses its tail to catch prey by dipping it in water at\nthe side of a river. However, this Pokémon often forgets what\nit’s doing and often spends entire days just loafing at\nwater’s edge.
ZKN_OMEGA_080_000	Slowbro’s tail has a Shellder firmly attached with a bite.\nAs a result, the tail can’t be used for fishing anymore.\nThis causes Slowbro to grudgingly swim and catch\nprey instead.
ZKN_OMEGA_081_000	Magnemite attaches itself to power lines to feed on electricity.\nIf your house has a power outage, check your circuit breakers.\nYou may find a large number of this Pokémon clinging to the\nbreaker box.
ZKN_OMEGA_082_000	Magneton emits a powerful magnetic force that is fatal to\nmechanical devices. As a result, large cities sound sirens\nto warn citizens of large-scale outbreaks of this Pokémon.
ZKN_OMEGA_083_000	Farfetch’d is always seen with a stalk from a plant of some\nsort. Apparently, there are good stalks and bad stalks. This\nPokémon has been known to fight with others over stalks.
ZKN_OMEGA_084_000	Doduo’s two heads never sleep at the same time. Its two\nheads take turns sleeping, so one head can always keep\nwatch for enemies while the other one sleeps.
ZKN_OMEGA_085_000	Watch out if Dodrio’s three heads are looking in three separate\ndirections. It’s a sure sign that it is on its guard. Don’t go near\nthis Pokémon if it’s being wary—it may decide to peck you.
ZKN_OMEGA_086_000	Seel hunts for prey in the frigid sea underneath sheets of ice.\nWhen it needs to breathe, it punches a hole through the ice\nwith the sharply protruding section of its head.
