ZKN_OMEGA_092_000	Gastly is largely composed of gaseous matter. When exposed\nto a strong wind, the gaseous body quickly dwindles away.\nGroups of this Pokémon cluster under the eaves of houses to\nescape the ravages of wind.
ZKN_OMEGA_093_000	Haunter is a dangerous Pokémon. If one beckons you while\nfloating in darkness, you must never approach it. This Pokémon\nwill try to lick you with its tongue and steal your life away.
ZKN_OMEGA_094_000	Sometimes, on a dark night, your shadow thrown by a\nstreetlight will suddenly and startlingly overtake you.\nIt is actually a Gengar running past you, pretending to be\nyour shadow.
ZKN_OMEGA_095_000	Onix has a magnet in its brain. It acts as a compass so that this\nPokémon does not lose direction while it is tunneling.\nAs it grows older, its body becomes increasingly rounder\nand smoother.
ZKN_OMEGA_096_000	If your nose becomes itchy while you are sleeping, it’s a sure\nsign that one of these Pokémon is standing above your pillow\nand trying to eat your dream through your nostrils.
ZKN_OMEGA_097_000	Hypno holds a pendulum in its hand. The arcing movement and\nglitter of the pendulum lull the foe into a deep state of\nhypnosis. While this Pokémon searches for prey, it polishes\nthe pendulum.
ZKN_OMEGA_098_000	Krabby live on beaches, burrowed inside holes dug into the\nsand. On sandy beaches with little in the way of food, these\nPokémon can be seen squabbling with each other\nover territory.

ZKN_OMEGA_101_000	Electrode eats electricity in the atmosphere. On days when\nlightning strikes, you can see this Pokémon exploding all over\nthe place from eating too much electricity.

ZKN_OMEGA_104_000	Cubone pines for the mother it will never see again.\nSeeing a likeness of its mother in the full moon, it cries.\nThe stains on the skull the Pokémon wears are made by the\ntears it sheds.

ZKN_OMEGA_111_000	Rhyhorn runs in a straight line, smashing everything in its path.\nIt is not bothered even if it rushes headlong into a block of\nsteel. This Pokémon may feel some pain from the collision the\nnext day, however.
ZKN_OMEGA_112_000	Rhydon’s horn can crush even uncut diamonds. One sweeping\nblow of its tail can topple a building. This Pokémon’s hide is\nextremely tough. Even direct cannon hits don’t leave a scratch.

ZKN_OMEGA_115_000	If you come across a young Kangaskhan playing by itself, you\nmust never disturb it or attempt to catch it. The baby\nPokémon’s parent is sure to be in the area, and it will become\nviolently enraged at you.
ZKN_OMEGA_116_000	Horsea eats small insects and moss off of rocks. If the ocean\ncurrent turns fast, this Pokémon anchors itself by wrapping its\ntail around rocks or coral to prevent being washed away.

ZKN_OMEGA_120_000	Staryu’s center section has an organ called the core that\nshines bright red. If you go to a beach toward the end of\nsummer, the glowing cores of these Pokémon look like the\nstars in the sky.
ZKN_OMEGA_121_000	Starmie’s center section—the core—glows brightly in seven\ncolors. Because of its luminous nature, this Pokémon has\nbeen given the nickname “the gem of the sea.”
ZKN_OMEGA_122_000	Mr. Mime is a master of pantomime. Its gestures and motions\nconvince watchers that something unseeable actually exists.\nOnce the watchers are convinced, the unseeable thing exists\nas if it were real.

ZKN_OMEGA_124_000	Jynx walks rhythmically, swaying and shaking its hips as if it\nwere dancing. Its motions are so bouncingly alluring, people\nseeing it are compelled to shake their hips without giving any\nthought to what they are doing.
ZKN_OMEGA_125_000	When a storm arrives, gangs of this Pokémon compete with\neach other to scale heights that are likely to be stricken by\nlightning bolts. Some towns use Electabuzz in place of\nlightning rods.
ZKN_OMEGA_126_000	In battle, Magmar blows out intensely hot flames from all\nover its body to intimidate its opponent. This Pokémon’s\nfiery bursts create heat waves that ignite grass and trees\nin its surroundings.

ZKN_OMEGA_129_000	Magikarp is a pathetic excuse for a Pokémon that is only\ncapable of flopping and splashing. This behavior prompted\nscientists to undertake research into it.
ZKN_OMEGA_130_000	When Magikarp evolves into Gyarados, its brain cells undergo a\nstructural transformation. It is said that this transformation is to\nblame for this Pokémon’s wildly violent nature.
ZKN_OMEGA_131_000	People have driven Lapras almost to the point of extinction.\nIn the evenings, this Pokémon is said to sing plaintively as it\nseeks what few others of its kind still remain.
ZKN_OMEGA_132_000	Ditto rearranges its cell structure to transform itself into other\nshapes. However, if it tries to transform itself into something\nby relying on its memory, this Pokémon manages to get\ndetails wrong.
ZKN_OMEGA_133_000	Eevee has an unstable genetic makeup that suddenly mutates\ndue to the environment in which it lives. Radiation from various\nstones causes this Pokémon to evolve.
ZKN_OMEGA_134_000	Vaporeon underwent a spontaneous mutation and grew fins\nand gills that allow it to live underwater. This Pokémon has the\nability to freely control water.
ZKN_OMEGA_135_000	Jolteon’s cells generate a low level of electricity. This power is\namplified by the static electricity of its fur, enabling the\nPokémon to drop thunderbolts. The bristling fur is made of\nelectrically charged needles.
ZKN_OMEGA_136_000	Flareon’s fluffy fur has a functional purpose—it releases heat\ninto the air so that its body does not get excessively hot.\nThis Pokémon’s body temperature can rise to a maximum of\n1,650 degrees Fahrenheit.
ZKN_OMEGA_137_000	Porygon is capable of reverting itself entirely back to program\ndata and entering cyberspace. This Pokémon is copy protected\nso it cannot be duplicated by copying.
ZKN_OMEGA_138_000	Omanyte is one of the ancient and long-since-extinct Pokémon\nthat have been regenerated from fossils by people. If attacked\nby an enemy, it withdraws itself inside its hard shell.
ZKN_OMEGA_139_000	Omastar uses its tentacles to capture its prey. It is believed to\nhave become extinct because its shell grew too large and\nheavy, causing its movements to become too slow\nand ponderous.
ZKN_OMEGA_140_000	Kabuto is a Pokémon that has been regenerated from a fossil.\nHowever, in extremely rare cases, living examples have been\ndiscovered. The Pokémon has not changed at all for\n300 million years.
ZKN_OMEGA_141_000	Kabutops swam underwater to hunt for its prey in ancient\ntimes. The Pokémon was apparently evolving from being a\nwater dweller to living on land as evident from the beginnings\nof change in its gills and legs.
ZKN_OMEGA_142_000	Aerodactyl is a Pokémon from the age of dinosaurs. It was\nregenerated from genetic material extracted from amber. It is\nimagined to have been the king of the skies in ancient times.
ZKN_OMEGA_143_000	Snorlax’s typical day consists of nothing more than eating and\nsleeping. It is such a docile Pokémon that there are children\nwho use its expansive belly as a place to play.
ZKN_OMEGA_144_000	Articuno is a legendary bird Pokémon that can control ice.\nThe flapping of its wings chills the air. As a result, it is said\nthat when this Pokémon flies, snow will fall.
ZKN_OMEGA_145_000	Zapdos is a legendary bird Pokémon that has the ability to\ncontrol electricity. It usually lives in thunderclouds.\nThe Pokémon gains power if it is stricken by lightning bolts.
ZKN_OMEGA_146_000	Moltres is a legendary bird Pokémon that has the ability to\ncontrol fire. If this Pokémon is injured, it is said to dip its body\nin the molten magma of a volcano to burn and heal itself.
ZKN_OMEGA_147_000	Dratini continually molts and sloughs off its old skin. It does so\nbecause the life energy within its body steadily builds to reach\nuncontrollable levels.
ZKN_OMEGA_148_000	Dragonair stores an enormous amount of energy inside its\nbody. It is said to alter weather conditions in its vicinity by\ndischarging energy from the crystals on its neck and tail.
ZKN_OMEGA_149_000	Dragonite is capable of circling the globe in just 16 hours.\nIt is a kindhearted Pokémon that leads lost and foundering\nships in a storm to the safety of land.
ZKN_OMEGA_150_000	Mewtwo is a Pokémon that was created by genetic\nmanipulation. However, even though the scientific power of\nhumans created this Pokémon’s body, they failed to endow\nMewtwo with a compassionate heart.
ZKN_OMEGA_151_000	Mew is said to possess the genetic composition of all\nPokémon. It is capable of making itself invisible at will,\nso it entirely avoids notice even if it approaches people.
ZKN_OMEGA_152_000	In battle, Chikorita waves its leaf around to keep the foe at\nbay. However, a sweet fragrance also wafts from the leaf,\nbecalming the battling Pokémon and creating a cozy, friendly\natmosphere all around.
ZKN_OMEGA_153_000	Bayleef’s neck is ringed by curled-up leaves. Inside each\ntubular leaf is a small shoot of a tree. The fragrance of this\nshoot makes people peppy.
ZKN_OMEGA_154_000	The fragrance of Meganium’s flower soothes and calms\nemotions. In battle, this Pokémon gives off more of its\nbecalming scent to blunt the foe’s fighting spirit.
ZKN_OMEGA_155_000	Cyndaquil protects itself by flaring up the flames on its back.\nThe flames are vigorous if the Pokémon is angry. However, if it\nis tired, the flames splutter fitfully with incomplete combustion.
ZKN_OMEGA_156_000	Quilava keeps its foes at bay with the intensity of its flames and\ngusts of superheated air. This Pokémon applies its outstanding\nnimbleness to dodge attacks even while scorching the foe\nwith flames.
ZKN_OMEGA_157_000	Typhlosion obscures itself behind a shimmering heat haze that\nit creates using its intensely hot flames. This Pokémon creates\nblazing explosive blasts that burn everything to cinders.
ZKN_OMEGA_158_000	Despite the smallness of its body, Totodile’s jaws are very\npowerful. While the Pokémon may think it is just playfully\nnipping, its bite has enough power to cause serious injury.
ZKN_OMEGA_159_000	Once Croconaw has clamped its jaws on its foe, it will\nabsolutely not let go. Because the tips of its fangs are forked\nback like barbed fishhooks, they become impossible to remove\nwhen they have sunk in.
ZKN_OMEGA_160_000	Feraligatr intimidates its foes by opening its huge mouth.\nIn battle, it will kick the ground hard with its thick and powerful\nhind legs to charge at the foe at an incredible speed.
ZKN_OMEGA_161_000	When Sentret sleeps, it does so while another stands guard.\nThe sentry wakes the others at the first sign of danger.\nWhen this Pokémon becomes separated from its pack,\nit becomes incapable of sleep due to fear.
ZKN_OMEGA_162_000	Furret has a very slim build. When under attack, it can slickly\nsquirm through narrow spaces and get away. In spite of its\nshort limbs, this Pokémon is very nimble and fleet.
ZKN_OMEGA_163_000	Hoothoot has an internal organ that senses and tracks the\nearth’s rotation. Using this special organ, this Pokémon begins\nhooting at precisely the same time every day.
ZKN_OMEGA_164_000	Noctowl never fails at catching prey in darkness. This Pokémon\nowes its success to its superior vision that allows it to see in\nminimal light, and to its soft, supple wings that make no sound\nin flight.
ZKN_OMEGA_165_000	Ledyba secretes an aromatic fluid from where its legs join its\nbody. This fluid is used for communicating with others.\nThis Pokémon conveys its feelings to others by altering the\nfluid’s scent.
ZKN_OMEGA_166_000	It is said that in lands with clean air, where the stars fill the\nsky, there live Ledian in countless numbers. There is a good\nreason for this—the Pokémon uses the light of the stars as\nits energy.
ZKN_OMEGA_167_000	The web spun by Spinarak can be considered its second\nnervous system. It is said that this Pokémon can determine\nwhat kind of prey is touching its web just by the tiny vibrations\nit feels through the web’s strands.

ZKN_OMEGA_171_000	Lanturn is nicknamed “the deep-sea star” for its illuminated\nantenna. This Pokémon produces light by causing a chemical\nreaction between bacteria and its bodily fluids inside\nthe antenna.
ZKN_OMEGA_172_000	Pichu charges itself with electricity more easily on days with\nthunderclouds or when the air is very dry. You can hear the\ncrackling of static electricity coming off this Pokémon.
ZKN_OMEGA_173_000	On nights with many shooting stars, Cleffa can be seen\ndancing in a ring. They dance through the night and stop only\nat the break of day, when these Pokémon quench their thirst\nwith the morning dew.
ZKN_OMEGA_174_000	Igglybuff’s vocal cords are not sufficiently developed. It would\nhurt its throat if it were to sing too much. This Pokémon\ngargles with freshwater from a clean stream.

ZKN_OMEGA_176_000	Togetic is said to be a Pokémon that brings good fortune.\nWhen the Pokémon spots someone who is pure of heart, it is\nsaid to appear and share its happiness with that person.
ZKN_OMEGA_177_000	Natu cannot fly because its wings are not yet fully grown.\nIf your eyes meet with this Pokémon’s eyes, it will stare back\nintently at you. But if you move even slightly, it will hop away\nto safety.
ZKN_OMEGA_178_000	Xatu stands rooted and still in one spot all day long.\nPeople believe that this Pokémon does so out of fear of the\nterrible things it has foreseen in the future.
ZKN_OMEGA_179_000	Mareep’s fluffy coat of wool rubs together and builds a static\ncharge. The more static electricity is charged, the more brightly\nthe lightbulb at the tip of its tail glows.

ZKN_OMEGA_183_000	Marill’s oil-filled tail acts much like a life preserver. If you see\njust its tail bobbing on the water’s surface, it’s a sure\nindication that this Pokémon is diving beneath the water to\nfeed on aquatic plants.
ZKN_OMEGA_184_000	Azumarill’s long ears are indispensable sensors. By focusing its\nhearing, this Pokémon can identify what kinds of prey are\naround, even in rough and fast-running rivers.
ZKN_OMEGA_185_000	Sudowoodo camouflages itself as a tree to avoid being\nattacked by enemies. However, because its hands remain\ngreen throughout the year, the Pokémon is easily identified\nas a fake during the winter.

ZKN_OMEGA_187_000	This Pokémon drifts and floats with the wind. If it senses the\napproach of strong winds, Hoppip links its leaves with other\nHoppip to prepare against being blown away.
ZKN_OMEGA_188_000	Skiploom’s flower blossoms when the temperature rises\nabove 64 degrees Fahrenheit. How much the flower opens\ndepends on the temperature. For that reason, this Pokémon\nis sometimes used as a thermometer.

ZKN_OMEGA_191_000	Sunkern tries to move as little as it possibly can. It does so\nbecause it tries to conserve all the nutrients it has stored in its\nbody for its evolution. It will not eat a thing, subsisting only on\nmorning dew.

ZKN_OMEGA_193_000	Yanma is capable of seeing 360 degrees without having to\nmove its eyes. It is a great flier that is adept at making sudden\nstops and turning midair. This Pokémon uses its flying ability to\nquickly chase down targeted prey.

ZKN_OMEGA_203_000	Girafarig’s rear head also has a brain, but it is small. The rear\nhead attacks in response to smells and sounds. Approaching\nthis Pokémon from behind can cause the rear head to suddenly\nlash out and bite.
ZKN_OMEGA_204_000	Pineco hangs from a tree branch and patiently waits for prey to\ncome along. If the Pokémon is disturbed while eating by\nsomeone shaking its tree, it drops down to the ground and\nexplodes with no warning.

ZKN_OMEGA_296_000	Makuhita is tenacious—it will keep getting up and attacking\nits foe however many times it is knocked down. Every time it\ngets back up, this Pokémon stores more energy in its body\nfor evolving.

ZKN_ULMOON_021_000	Due to its short wings, it can’t fly long\ndistances. It wanders about restlessly and\npecks at bug Pokémon.

nx_zukan_topics_guide_010	[VAR 01DA(0000)] (Completed Tasks: [VAR 0201(0001)])
nx_zukan_help1_010	This is the grand Pokédex that Grand Oak whipped up.\nNeat-o, right? It’ll automatically register any Pokémon you bring\nalong to your cozy Boxes here in Pokémon HOME!
nx_zukan_help1_020	Of course it’s a super goal to complete the WHOLE Pokédex with\nevery last Pokémon out there! But, boy, is that ever a lot of work!\nTry using Spotlight Mode to focus in on different regional Pokédexes,\nand keep chipping away at that goal—one region at a time!
nx_zukan_help1_030	But that’s not all! Have you tried giving your L or R Buttons a squeeze?\nPress ’em and you’ll be switched right on over to your Research Tasks!\nGrand Oak himself wants YOUR help with his great research,\nso help an old man out, won’t you?
nx_zukan_help2_010	This here is the details screen, where you’ll find all the spiffy key details\nabout your Pokémon crammed into one place!\nGet started off by choosing a Pokémon from the list on the right!
nx_zukan_help2_020	If you want to learn even more about your Pokémon,\ngive your ZL or ZR Buttons a friendly tap, won’t you?\nYou’ll be able to see their Pokédex entries from different games\nyou’ve found ’em in. It’s super nifty!
nx_zukan_help2_030	And if you’ve got Pokémon that you’ve registered in more than one form,\nyou can use those handy L and R Buttons to flip between their forms!\nDid you know that sometimes forms have different Pokédex entries, too?\nBe sure you give ’em all a good look!
nx_zukan_help2_040	And you’ve got the Y Button there to help you check which games\nthat Pokémon appears in.\nThat means you might be able to get the Pokémon in those games!
nx_zukan_help3_010	This list view lets you just go on and take a gander at all the Pokémon\nyou’ve registered in all their glory! It sure is a sight, isn’t it?\nWhenever you want to take a closer look at any one of your Pokémon\nas you scroll through, give that A Button a little press!
nx_zukan_help3_020	The X Button opens up the filter window! Fwooosh! Just like that!\nYou can filter your list of Pokémon by all sorts of conditions, including\nthings like their types, their main color, or even shape!\nWant to know what my type is? Why, I’m the having-a-ball type!
nx_zukan_help3_030	The Y Button lets you change up the order that your Pokémon are\nsorted in! Sure, you’ve got your familiar old Pokédex-number order...\nBut how about sorting by height or by weight? It’s good to turn things\non their head sometimes and look at ’em from a whole new angle!
nx_zukan_help4_010	Research Tasks might seem a bit taxing, but they’re really rewarding!\nThey’re requests that come from Grand Oak, see, and what could\nbe better than helping out the grand old gent himself?
nx_zukan_help4_020	If you’ve got save data on your Nintendo Switch from a region\nthat Grand Oak wants to research, then you’ll see task lists start\npopping up for each region on this screen!
nx_zukan_help4_030	But consider this your warning, pal! To complete a task, you’ve got to get\nthe Pokémon Grand Oak is interested in seeing AND get it in that same\nregion as the task belongs to. He’s a bit of a stickler like that!
nx_zukan_help5_010	On the right side of this screen, you’ve got your list of Research Tasks.\nAll you’ve got to do to complete a Research Task is get your hands on the\nnecessary Pokémon! I bet you’re a catching pro, aren’t you?
nx_zukan_help5_020	But there are still a few little tricks to these tasks!\nEven if you get your hands on the right Pokémon species, it won’t\ncount if it’s from the wrong game or in the wrong form!\nBe sure you check carefully where your Pokémon were caught!
nx_zukan_help5_030	But if you do manage to get the right Pokémon that meet every condition,\nthen all you have to do is bring ’em to your Pokémon HOME Boxes and\nyou’ll find your tasks automatically get marked off as complete!\nYou don’t even have to lift a finger!
nx_zukan_help5_031	And once a task is done, it’s done for good.\nIt won’t be affected if you take the Pokémon you used to fulfill a task\nout of Pokémon HOME or if you decide to let ’em go.\nNo one can take this accomplishment away from you, champ!
